0.title: Federer shares video of practising on court ahead of comeback at Laver Cup 2022
0.article_body: Roger Federer took to Instagram to share a video of himself wherein he's seen practising on the court ahead of his comeback at Laver Cup 2022. The 20-time Grand Slam champion had confirmed that he'll be playing for the first time at Laver Cup since his Wimbledon 2021 quarter-final loss. The tournament will be held in London from September 23-25.

1.title: Army arrests Pakistani intruder near LoC in J&K's Rajouri district
1.article_body: The Indian Army arrested a Pakistani intruder near the Line of Control in Jammu and Kashmir's Rajouri district on Sunday. Officials said no incriminating materials have been recovered from the intruder so far. The intruder is currently being treated in a medical facility after army personnel opened fire noticing suspicious movement from across the border in the Nowshera sector.

2.title: No Look Out Circular issued against Sisodia in excise policy scam yet: CBI officials
2.article_body: CBI officials on Sunday refuted reports that Look Out Circulars were issued against Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia and others in the excise policy scam case. The officials said that the process of scrutinising documents is going on and notices are being issued to suspects for questioning. Responding to reports, Sisodia said he is roaming freely in Delhi.

3.title: No consideration to levy any charges for UPI services: Govt on reports
3.article_body: After reports surfaced that the government is planning to impose extra charges to be paid for every UPI payment, the Ministry of Finance said, "There is no consideration in Govt to levy any charges for UPI services." It added, "The concerns of the service providers for cost recovery have to be met through other means."

4.title: 2 Assam imams arrested over alleged links with Al-Qaeda affiliate
4.article_body: Two imams with suspected links to Al Qaida in Indian Subcontinent (AQIS) and the Bangladesh-based terror group Ansarullah Bangla Team (ABT) have been arrested in Assam's Goalpara district, police said on Sunday. Their names surfaced after the arrest of one Abbas Ali in July. In Assam, more than 23 individuals have been arrested in recent months over alleged terror links.

5.title: I am trending on Twitter but why: Mohammad Amir after Shaheen gets ruled out of Asia Cup
5.article_body: After Shaheen Afridi got ruled out of Asia Cup 2022 due to injury, Pakistani fast bowler Mohammad Amir tweeted, "I am trending on Twitter but why?" Mohammad Amir had announced his retirement from international cricket aged 28 in December 2020 due to the then PCB management. "People want you to be a part of Asia Cup," a Twitter user wrote.

6.title: Punjab to reserve law officer posts for Scheduled Caste persons
6.article_body: The Punjab government has announced reservation for Scheduled Caste (SC) persons in law officer posts in the state government. Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann said 58 new law officer posts were being created for the same in the Advocate General's office. He added that Punjab will be the first to have such a provision for lawyers from the SC community.

7.title: Underdogs don't give up: UK PM hopeful Rishi Sunak in campaign video
7.article_body: UK PM candidate Rishi Sunak has released a campaign video, which terms him an "underdog", two weeks before the Conservative Party leadership poll is set to draw to a close. "They say beware [of] the underdog, because an underdog has...nothing to lose...underdogs don't give up," the voiceover in the video says. The election's results will be announced on September 5.

8.title: If rape convicts can be freed, why not Sikh prisoners: SGPC chief
8.article_body: Shiromani Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee President Harjinder Dhami alleged that the Centre was adopting a discriminatory policy towards Sikhs. "On one side...the government is releasing convicts of...rape...while on the other side, Sikh prisoners are kept lodged in jails for three decades," Dhami said. Recently, the Gujarat government released 11 convicts in the Bilkis Bano gangrape case.

9.title: Bodies of woman, her 2 children found in a pond in Assam
9.article_body: After missing from their house since Saturday, the bodies of a 30-year-old woman and her two children were found in a pond in Assam's Nagaon district on Sunday. The deceased woman, Niru Bordoloi, and her two children were residents of the district's Madhya Tupakuchi village, police said. Notably, police are probing the reason behind their death.

10.title: Man slaps woman toll booth worker when asked to pay toll in MP; video surfaces
10.article_body: A video has surfaced that shows a man slapping a woman toll booth worker on being asked to pay toll in Madhya Pradesh's Rajgarh. The woman hit him back with her footwear. The incident took place when the man claimed that he was a local and should be exempted from paying the toll charges. He didn't have any supporting documents.

11.title: I've boring life, what will you ask: Taapsee on not being part of 'Koffee...'
11.article_body: Taapsee Pannu, opening up about not being invited to 'Koffee With Karan', said, "I've...boring life, what will you ask?" She added all exciting part of her life is out in open. "But that's not exciting enough...[for]...that kind of show," she added. In an earlier interview, Taapsee jokingly said her sex life wasn't interesting enough to be invited to the show.

12.title: Pak must capitalise on India's premier pacers missing out in Asia Cup: Nawaz
12.article_body: Ahead of upcoming India-Pakistan group stage match at Asia Cup 2022, Sarfraz Nawaz said Pakistan should capitalise on India's bowling attack as their premier pacers Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammad Shami are missing out. He added that Pakistan should replicate the same result (win) from the T20 World Cup last year. The match will be played on August 28 in Dubai.

13.title: Pope calls for talks to resolve Church-govt crisis in Nicaragua
13.article_body: Pope Francis on Sunday called for an "open and sincere" dialogue to resolve the ongoing conflict between the Church and government in Nicaragua. This comes following the arrest of Bishop Rolando Alvarez, an influential figure of the Nicaraguan Church. Alvarez is seen as a leading critic of President Daniel Ortega. Several priests have been detained in Nicaragua in recent months.

14.title: Ex-CEO of OML which organises NH7 Weekender, raided over Delhi excise policy scam
14.article_body: Only Much Louder's (OML) ex-CEO Vijay Nair has said his Mumbai home was raided by CBI in connection to Delhi excise policy scam in which Deputy CM Manish Sisodia is an accused. OML organises NH7 Weekender concerts and managed AlB. Rejecting reports that he fled the country, he said, "I spoke to CBI officers who were present at my residence."

15.title: Nepotism claims in university appointments to be probed: Kerala Guv
15.article_body: Kerala Governor Arif Mohammad Khan on Sunday said that he will order a full-fledged investigation into allegations of nepotism in appointments made to various posts in state universities. Earlier this week, Khan stayed the appointment of Kerala CM's private secretary KK Ragesh's wife as a Kannur University associate professor. She has been accused of landing the job through unfair means.

16.title: Ranveer Singh seeks 2 weeks' time to appear before Mumbai Police in nude photoshoot case
16.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh, who was summoned by Mumbai Police to record his statement on August 22 in connection with an FIR registered against him over his nude photoshoot, has sought more time from the police. "The actor has sought two weeks' time to appear, now fresh summons will be sent...after fixing a new date," Mumbai Police stated.

17.title: Army guys are pissed with the movie: Meera Chopra on Aamir's 'Laal...'
17.article_body: Actress Meera Chopra, Priyanka Chopra's cousin, spoke about Aamir Khan's 'Laal Singh Chaddha' and said, "I have a problem with [the film] on fundamental issues." She added that whatever the film "showed against the Army was not cool". "Talk to Army guys, they are pissed with the movie. I come from an Army family," Meera further said.

18.title: RSS working to make India a model society for whole world: Bhagwat
18.article_body: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat on Sunday said that the organisation is working to awaken and unify the society so that India can emerge as a "model society for the entire world". "We need to prioritise us above 'my and mine' while doing welfare work and this will help us evolve as a society," Bhagwat said at an event in Delhi.

19.title: S Lanka aims to get 10 lakh tourists this year, most from India: Minister
19.article_body: Amid Sri Lanka's economic crisis, the country's Tourism Minister Harin Fernando on Saturday said that the government aims to receive at least 10 lakh tourists this year, mostly from India. Fernando added that religious and cultural tourism between Sri Lanka and India "will make a lot of sense". Sri Lanka is currently receiving approximately 2,000 tourists per day, he said.

20.title: It could be due to workload: Javed on Shaheen's injury ahead of Asia Cup
20.article_body: Ex-Pakistan cricketer Aaqib Javed said Shaheen Shah Afridi's knee injury ahead of Asia Cup 2022 could be due to workload as the Pakistan pacer has been playing continuously. "Team management should deal with patience. Do not panic in this situation and let Shaheen recover completely," he added. Shaheen sustained the injury during the first Test against Sri Lanka in Galle.

21.title: Whole country wants to see Kejriwal as the next PM: Sisodia
21.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal becoming the next PM is not an individual's ambition, but the whole country wants it, Deputy Delhi CM Manish Sisodia said on Sunday. "People see Kejriwal as an alternative to Modi in 2024 because he talks about health, education and employment," said Sisodia. BJP and CBI have a motive to stop Kejriwal, Sisodia added.

22.title: Police allow murder accused to meet girlfriend in K'taka lodge, booked
22.article_body: The police allegedly allowed a murder accused, who was brought to court for a hearing, to spend time with his girlfriend at a lodge in Karnataka's Dharwad on Saturday, following which the policemen were booked. The accused policemen acted like guards and protected the room, reports said. Vidyagiri Police raided the room where the murder accused was staying.

23.title: Somali forces end 30-hour siege at hotel, over 20 people killed
23.article_body: Somali authorities on Sunday ended a deadly 30-hour-long siege by gunmen at a hotel in Mogadishu, in which over 20 people were killed and many others were left wounded. The attack, which began on Friday evening, had started with loud explosions. "During the attack, the security forces rescued many civilians trapped in the hotel, including...children," a police official said.

24.title: Industries can make startups more result-oriented: Jitendra Singh
24.article_body: Union Minister of state for Science and Technology, Dr Jitendra Singh, said that to make the Indian startup ecosystem more result-oriented, industries should partner with startups. Dr Singh added that for the ecosystem to be sustainable, academia institutions need to link each stage with the industry. He said that the science and technology department can provide liberal funding to startups.

25.title: Telugu actor Junior NTR to meet Union Minister Amit Shah over dinner
25.article_body: 'RRR' actor Junior NTR will meet Union Home Minister Amit Shah over dinner on Sunday. Shah is in Telangana to address a public rally in the state's Nalgonda district. The actor is among several prominent personalities scheduled to meet Shah at Ramoji Film City. Junior NTR is the grandson of Telugu Desam Party (TDP) founder NT Rama Rao.

26.title: IndiGo pilots declare 'Mayday' after false smoke warning in Delhi-Kolkata flight
26.article_body: The pilots of a Delhi-Kolkata IndiGo flight on Sunday declared 'Mayday' (the international radio distress signal used by ships and aircraft) following a smoke warning that turned out to be fake, officials said. Pilots of flight 6E-2513 asked Kolkata ATC for a priority landing after a warning of smoke in the cargo area. The flight was safely landed.

27.title: Pegasus spyware maker NSO Group's CEO Shalev Hulio steps down
27.article_body: NSO Group, the maker of the Pegasus spyware, announced that its Chief Executive Officer Shalev Hulio is stepping down with immediate effect. The company has appointed Chief Operating Officer Yaron Shohat to oversee the company's reorganisation and will also lead the company till a successor is named. As part of its reorganisation, the company will reportedly fire around 100 employees.

28.title: We don't influence share prices: Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma
28.article_body: Paytm MD and CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma told shareholders that the company has no influence on stock prices, however, the management is making efforts to make the firm profitable. "Macro, micro, international investors, and several other sentiments play a role in share prices," Sharma said. Paytm will post operational profit in the quarter ending September 2023, he added.

29.title: Shameful & disturbing: Shiv Sena MP on Noida woman abusing guard
29.article_body: After a video showed a woman abusing a security guard in a residential society in Noida, Shiv Sena MP Priyanka Chaturvedi said it is disturbing and shameful. "Using classist slurs and abusing people of a state is criminal and shameful, hope UP police ensures she is punished for this behaviour," Chaturvedi added. The woman also pushed the guard.

30.title: Chiranjeevi's 'Bholaa Shankar' to release on April 14, 2023
30.article_body: Ahead of Tollywood actor Chiranjeevi's birthday, the makers of 'Bholaa Shankar' announced the film's release date. Taking to Twitter, director Meher Ramesh shared that the film will release worldwide on April 14, 2023. "Wishing the swagster of Indian cinema a very happy birthday," his tweet read. 'Bholaa Shankar' also stars Keerthy Suresh and Tamannaah Bhatia.

31.title: Video of Dalit man being beaten with slippers in UP surfaces, village head among 2 held
31.article_body: A video of a Dalit man being beaten with slippers by two men in UP's Muzaffarnagar district has surfaced. As per reports, the Dalit man had made some comments about the village head. The duo were called by a former village head to his house, where the Dalit man was beaten by the two. Police have arrested the two accused.

32.title: Kejriwal, Sisodia are 'twin towers of corruption': BJP spokesperson
32.article_body: Posing questions to AAP on the excise policy scam, BJP spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla on Sunday called AAP leaders Arvind Kejriwal and Manish Sisodia "the twin towers of corruption". Through a series of tweets, Poonawalla posed several questions, including, "Is it not true that an illegal waiver was given to the liquor mafia of ₹144 crore?"

33.title: 17-yr-old dies by suicide after losing PUBG game in Bihar
33.article_body: A 17-year-old boy allegedly died by suicide on Friday night, after losing a game of PUBG in Bihar's Bhagalpur district. The deceased's family claimed that he used to get upset each time he lost a game of PUBG, however, the police believe the minor could've taken the extreme step after a girl he loved rejected his proposal.

34.title: Govt denies report saying wheat reserves are lowest in 14 yrs, says 'stocks sufficient'
34.article_body: After a Bloomberg report said that wheat reserves in India in August declined to the lowest level in 14 years, the government said the country's wheat stocks are "sufficient" for "our domestic requirements". "There is no such plan to import wheat into India," said the Department of Food and Public Distribution replying to the report.

35.title: Karthikeya 2's Hindi version earns ₹11 cr, RGV calls it 'bigger' than RRR & KGF
35.article_body: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma took to Twitter to laud filmmaker Chandoo Mondeti whose film 'Karthikeya 2' has collected ₹11.25 crore so far in the Hindi belt. He wrote, "#karthikeya2 on 2nd Friday doing double collections of Aamir Khan's Laal Singh Chaddha and Akshay Kumar's Raksha Bandhan." RGV added, "K2 is bigger blockbuster than RRR and KGF2...CONGRATS to Chandoo Mondeti."

36.title: NGO owner forces 25-yr-old woman into flesh trade in B'luru, gets her gangraped; arrested
36.article_body: The Karnataka Police have arrested the owner of an NGO called 'Nav Bharat' and her two associates on charges of forcing a 25-year-old woman into flesh trade and getting her gangraped, police said on Sunday. The police have booked cases under IPC Section 370 (buying any person as a slave) and the Immoral Traffic Prevention Act, 1956.

37.title: Odegaard's brace helped Arsenal beat Bournemouth in Premier League
37.article_body: Captain Martin Odegaard scored twice inside the opening 11 minutes before William Saliba's goal in the second half helped Arsenal defeat newly-promoted Bournemouth 3-0 in the Premier League on Saturday. With this, Arsenal moved to the top of the points table. Notably, it is the first time Arsenal have won their opening three matches since the 2004-05 season.

38.title: Priyadarshan to direct his first Malayalam thriller
38.article_body: Filmmaker Priyadarshan will be directing and producing his first Malayalam thriller with Shane Nigam and Arjun Ashokan as the lead. He said the shoot will begin in November "in a start-to-finish schedule of 45 days in Cochin". Priyadarshan, who has also written the film, said the basic idea of the film is inspired by Japanese filmmaker Akira Kurosawa's 'Stray Dog'.

39.title: E-hawala gang with alleged links to Pak busted in Gurugram, 4 held
39.article_body: Police on Saturday arrested four members of an e-hawala gang from Gurugram for allegedly threatening a businessman and demanding ₹5 lakh from him. The victim reportedly received threats through a video call on his WhatsApp number, police said. As many as 99 ATM cards were recovered from the gang's possession, which has alleged links with other gang members in Pakistan.

40.title: Kangana suing Filmfare for inviting her, says 'Shocked they are still nominating me'
40.article_body: Kangana Ranaut has revealed she's going to sue Filmfare for inviting her as they want to give her an award. "I've banned unethical..and totally unfair practices like Filmfare since 2014," she wrote. "I'm shocked to know...they're still nominating me. It's beneath my dignity...work ethics and value system to encourage such corrupt practices...that's why I've decided to sue Filmfare," she added.

41.title: Mammootty meets Mohanlal, pic sparks rumours on 'Harikrishnans 2'
41.article_body: Malayalam actor Mammootty recently met Mohanlal at his new house. The picture, which Mohanlal and Mammootty shared on their respective Twitter handles, sparked rumours that the two are set to star in director Fazil's 'Harikrishnans 2'. While the makers have not shared an official confirmation on the project, the two will reportedly reprise their roles in the 'Harikrishnans' sequel.

42.title: A contemporary I really respected: Taapsee on what she thinks about Kangana
42.article_body: In a recent live session on Instagram, actress Taapsee Pannu was asked to share 'what comes to her mind first' when someone says Kangana Ranaut. To this, she replied, "A contemporary who I really respected." Kangana once called Taapsee a "B-grade actress". Kangana's sister Rangoli had also called Taapsee a "sasti copy" of Kangana.

43.title: Ukrainian ammunition depot storing HIMARS missiles hit: Russia
43.article_body: Russia said on Sunday that its Kalibr missiles had destroyed a Ukrainian ammunition depot storing missiles for US-made HIMARS rocket systems in Ukraine's Odesa region. However, Kyiv refuted the claim and said that the missile had hit a granary. Russia's defence ministry also said that its forces had succeeded in destroying two M777 Howitzers in combat positions in Kherson region.

44.title: Odisha issues flood alert in 2 districts amid Subarnarekha swelling
44.article_body: As the Subarnarekha river swells after incessant rains, Odisha has sounded a flood alert in Mayurbhanj and Balasore districts. The state is already reeling under floods in the northern region in the Mahanadi river system. Low-lying areas such as Fuladi, Chandamaripadia, Kantabanji and Pasimila areas of Balasore town have been inundated, by a swelling in the Budhabalanga river.

45.title: Body of 8-yr-old boy found in canal in Punjab; uncle arrested
45.article_body: The body of an eight-year-old boy was recovered from a canal three days after he went missing from his home in Punjab's Ludhiana. Swaran Singh, the paternal uncle of the deceased child, Sehajpreet Singh, was arrested for allegedly killing the boy, police said. Notably, Swaran reportedly had some issues with his younger brother and sister-in-law, the parents of the deceased.

46.title: Can't declare Satyendar Jain as 'person with unsound mind': Delhi HC
46.article_body: The Delhi HC has quashed public interest litigation (PIL) seeking to declare Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain as a "person with unsound mind" or disqualify him from being an MLA and minister. The plea had been filed by Ashish Kumar Srivastava, who claims himself to be a social worker. Jain is currently under judicial custody on charges of money laundering.

47.title: I consider domestic, IPL, international levels of cricket the same: Venkatesh
47.article_body: Talking about how he adjusts to the requirements of different levels of cricket, India all-rounder Venkatesh Iyer said the pressure is the same across domestic, IPL and international levels. "The time that you take to adapt to...pressure of each level is probably different. But I consider all levels the same," he added. Venkatesh last played for India in February 2022.

48.title: 'Laal...' flopped, it shows superstardom era has gone: Dobaaraa's Vidusshi
48.article_body: Actress Vidusshi Mehra, who currently stars in Anurag Kashyap's directorial 'Dobaaraa', has said that big films like 'Laal Singh Chaddha' have flopped, which shows that "the superstardom era has gone". "Now people don't have the patience for Aamir Khan or Salman Khan," she added. Vidusshi further said the COVID-19 pandemic has "hurt the industry badly".

49.title: 74 artificial ponds to be set up for Ganesh idol immersion in Hyd
49.article_body: Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) is in the process of setting up 74 artificial ponds for the immersion of Ganesh idols ahead of Ganesh Chaturthi in Hyderabad. Out of the 74 artificial water bodies, 28 have already been set up. Of the remaining 46 ponds, 22 will be artificial ones, excavation for which are underway.

50.title: Mumbai NCB busts interstate cartel smuggling banned cough syrup
50.article_body: NCB's Mumbai unit has busted an interstate cartel involved in smuggling banned codeine-based cough syrup (CBCS) by arresting five persons and seized contraband worth ₹50 lakh, an official said on Sunday. The kingpin of the cartel, who also owns medical shops in Mumbai, operated secretly and most gang members were unaware of his name, face and location, the official said.

51.title: Man kills 70-yr-old grandfather over property dispute in B'luru; held
51.article_body: A 20-year-old man, along with his friend, killed his grandfather over a property dispute in Bengaluru. Police arrested both the accused from Mysuru. The 70-year-old victim's grandson was unhappy with him for not parting with the property and not helping him to get bank loans. Both the accused went to his home and smothered him to death.

52.title: Jharkhand, UP facing drought-like conditions: Govt report
52.article_body: As per a state Agriculture Department assessment report, in Jharkhand, 97 rain-deficient blocks across 15 districts meet all parameters that define a drought. In Uttar Pradesh, several districts have drought-like conditions after 64 districts received lesser rainfall this monsoon. Till August 15, in Jharkhand, paddy was only sown on 5.4 lakh hectares compared to 16.3 lakh hectares last season.

53.title: Chahal's wife Dhanashree reacts to facing divorce rumours while dealing with major injury
53.article_body: Cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal's wife Dhanashree Verma penned a note on facing divorce rumours while dealing with a major injury. "As recommended by...doctors... I'll be undergoing my surgery if I wish to dance again," she wrote. "This is when I needed the most support...and this is exactly the time when people picked up some random news about us...It was...hateful," she added.

54.title: Amid polling in West Bengal's Asansol, TMC and BJP workers clash
54.article_body: Bharatiya Janata Party and Trinamool Congress workers clashed amid municipal corporation by-elections at Asansol and Bongaon in West Bengal. BJP MLA Lakshman Chandra Ghorui alleged that TMC supporters attacked party workers when they were checking polling stations, and accused them of rigging the elections. BJP also alleged that TMC goons obstructed the polling process by looting votes in Bongaon.

55.title: Woman who abused & hit security guard in Noida society arrested
55.article_body: A woman who allegedly misbehaved with a security guard of Jaypee Wishtown Society in Noida has been arrested. In a video that has surfaced on social media, the woman can be seen shouting at the security guard, using abusive language and pushing him roughly. The security guard filed a complaint at the Sector 126 police station.

56.title: Bengaluru logs 965 new COVID-19 cases, positivity rate at 6.96%
56.article_body: Bengaluru reported 965 fresh cases of COVID-19 with a positivity rate of 6.96% in 24 hours, as per data shared by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) chief on Saturday. With the addition of these case, the city's cumulative case tally reached 18,57,744. According to the data, no new fatalities due to COVID-19 were recorded. Bengaluru's active caseload stood at 7,405.

57.title: Don't use sanctions as a tool of pressure: Taliban to UNSC
57.article_body: Taliban government's Ministry of Foreign Affairs in a statement has called on United Nations Security Council (UNSC) to not "use sanctions as a tool of pressure". This comes after United Nations failed to reach an agreement on the extension of travel exemptions for 13 Taliban officials. "Some bigoted western circles are...trying to create distance between Afghanistan and...world," the ministry said.

58.title: Great pride: Anurag on Antim winning gold at U-20 Wrestling World C'ships
58.article_body: Praising 17-year-old wrestler Antim Panghal after she became the first Indian woman to win a gold medal at Under-20 Wrestling World Championships, Sports Minister Anurag Thakur tweeted, "Great pride for the nation." He added, "It's also India's best ever performance at the event with 14 medals (seven men; seven women)." Antim defeated Kazakhstan's Altyn Shagayeva 8-0 in 53 kg final.

59.title: Lumpy skin disease spreads to 8 states/UTs, 7,300 cattle dead so far
59.article_body: Over 7,300 cattle have died and more than 1.85 lakh are affected in eight states and Union Territories with the 'lumpy skin disease', Centre said. Punjab, Rajasthan and Gujarat account for about 95% of the infections, with J&K, Uttarakhand, Himachal Pradesh, Andaman & Nicobar Islands and Madhya Pradesh also reporting cases. The current mortality rate is about 1% to 2%.

60.title: Withdraw circular on 'cancelling' EWS admissions: LS MP to Delhi govt
60.article_body: Lok Sabha MP Parvesh Sahib Singh has demanded the Delhi government roll back a circular, which he said aims to cancel the admission of children in 'economically weaker section' (EWS) and 'disadvantage group' categories in unaided schools. As per the circular, all admissions taken after 2016-17 in the offline mode under these categories won't be recognised by the Delhi government.

61.title: Kareena starts working on Hansal Mehta's thriller, shares script's glimpse
61.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor Khan has started working on the upcoming Hansal Mehta directorial, which also marks her debut as a producer. On Saturday, Kareena shared a picture of the film's script. The film, which was announced in 2021, marks Kareena's first collaboration with Hansal Mehta. The makers had earlier said that the film will be a "gripping and moody thriller".

62.title: Ladakh rolls out EV policy to encourage buyers with subsidies
62.article_body: Ladakh has rolled out Electric Vehicle and Allied Infrastructure Policy to encourage people to opt for battery-powered vehicles for a carbon-neutral future, an official told PTI. The policy guarantees capital subsidy of 10% on two-wheelers, three-wheelers and four-wheelers. Ladakh has offered to subsidise commercial public electric vehicle charging stations for two-wheelers, cars and buses.

63.title: If game vs Manchester United is postponed, we should get points: Liverpool's Klopp
63.article_body: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp has said they should get points if their game against Manchester United on Monday night is postponed due to protests. "We've nothing to do with the situation if (United) supporters don't want the game to happen," he added. United fans have planned a protest against the Glazer family's ownership of the club ahead of the game.

64.title: BJP MP seeks removal of Bihar Agriculture Minister over rice scam
64.article_body: BJP MP Sushil Kumar Modi has sought the removal of Bihar's new Agriculture Minister Sudhakar Singh over the 2013 rice scam. He claimed that RJD leader Sudhakar Singh was charged with embezzling ₹5.31 crore. “When he approached the HC for bail, he was asked to deposit ₹60 lakh after which he was granted bail,” he said.

65.title: Police allow murder accused to stay with lover in K'taka hotel, case filed
65.article_body: A case was filed against Ballari police personnel after some officials allegedly facilitated stay of a murder accused with his lover in a hotel in Karnataka. Reports said that the police produced him before a court and then allowed him to stay with his lover. Police personnel also reportedly stood guard at the place.

66.title: ITBP soldiers cross river as part of 7,575-km long Amrit relay, video shared
66.article_body: A video of ITBP soldiers carrying a Tiranga and crossing a mountain river using a rope while chanting 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' was shared on Twitter. This is a part of a relay Long Range Patrol ‘Amrit’ that started on August 1 and will end on October 14 after completing a 75-day journey covering a distance of approximately 7,575 km.

67.title: Deep depression weakens, rainfall likely in MP, Chhattisgarh: IMD
67.article_body: The deep depression over northwest Chhattisgarh, adjoining Madhya Pradesh and southeast UP has weakened into a depression. The India Meteorological Department claimed that the depression will continue to move west-northwestwards across north MP and weakens into a low-pressure area in 24 hours. However, IMD predicted that heavy rainfall at most places will continue over the respective areas.

68.title: Pune man held for killing wife, infant after decomposing bodies found in well
68.article_body: Days after decomposing bodies of a 22-year-old woman and her infant child were found in a well in Shirur taluka of Pune, police have arrested the woman's husband for murdering them. The bodies were found on August 8. Officials said that the husband pushed the woman and the child into the well following domestic issues.

69.title: 4 more grain ships leave Ukraine, brings total number to 31
69.article_body: The Turkish Defence Ministry said on Sunday that four more ships carrying grain have left Ukraine's ports. This brings the total number of ships that have left Ukraine under the UN-brokered grain export deal to 31. "In addition, one ship from Ukraine and five ships that will go to Ukraine will be inspected today," the ministry added.

70.title: Japan's Lixil Corporation eyes ₹1,000 cr sales in India in 3 years
70.article_body: Japan-based housing equipment company Lixil Corporation is aiming ₹1,000 crore worth of sales in India in the next three years, a Lixil official said. Bobby Joseph, India and Subcontinent leader told PTI that the capacity of its Vijayawada ceramic plant could be doubled to two million units. Lixil is working on a long-term strategy for the Indian market, Joseph added.

71.title: Mizoram CM issues public apology after video showed daughter hitting doctor
71.article_body: Mizoram CM Zoramthanga issued a public apology after a video of his daughter Milari Chhangte assaulting a doctor went viral. Milari was reportedly upset after the doctor refused to see her without an appointment. In a handwritten note, the CM apologised for his daughter's "misbehaviour". The Mizoram unit of IMA also wore black badges to work over this incident.

72.title: Manish Sisodia is 'Liquor Minister’: BJP's Adesh Gupta
72.article_body: Reacting to the alleged liquor scam, Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta called Deputy CM Manish Sisodia "Liquor Minister". He alleged that the excise policy of the Delhi government was sinful, corrupt and tyrannical. "It is seen for the first time in independent India that the Education Minister is the Liquor Minister,” Adesh Gupta said.

73.title: Man hides spy camera in charger, blackmails B'luru woman with private videos
73.article_body: Bengaluru City Police arrested a 30-year-old man, who allegedly blackmailed his woman friend into having a physical relationship with him by capturing her private videos using a spy camera, officers said on Saturday. The accused recorded videos of the woman changing her clothes, police said. He used the videos to demand a physical relationship from the woman, the investigation revealed.

74.title: Kejriwal model failed, corruption reached its peak in Delhi: Union Minister
74.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Sunday said that Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal’s model has failed in the national capital. "Corruption has reached its peak," Thakur added. "The taking back of excise policy in Delhi after CBI's raid proves corruption has happened...Kingpin Arvind Kejriwal will have to answer for this," Thakur stated.

75.title: Security increased in Delhi ahead of farmers' protest at Jantar Mantar
75.article_body: Delhi Police put up cemented barricades and tightened security at the Delhi-Haryana's Tikri border ahead of a protest called by farmers at Jantar Mantar on Monday. The farmers are planning to stage a protest against unemployment and other issues in the country. Farmer leader Rakesh Tikait was detained while he was entering Delhi to take part in the protest.

76.title: NZ to temporarily boost foreign worker intake, alter immigration rules
76.article_body: New Zealand will make temporary changes to its immigration rules to hire thousands of extra workers amid a labour shortage, Immigration Minister Michael Wood said on Sunday. The country will revise its Working Holiday Visa scheme with the aim to attract 12,000 foreign workers. "These measures are about providing immediate relief to...businesses hardest hit by...global worker shortage," Wood said.

77.title: Vijay Shekhar Sharma's reappointment as Paytm MD & CEO gets shareholders' nod
77.article_body: The reappointment of Vijay Shekhar Sharma as Paytm's MD and CEO for a five-year period has been approved by its shareholders. A total of 99.67% shareholders voted in favour of Sharma's reappointment, Paytm's parent company said. The shareholders further approved a resolution to fix Sharma's remuneration for the next three years without any annual increment, with 94.48% votes in favour.

78.title: Slept for 10 hrs after shooting Shehzada's climax scene: Kartik
78.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan took to Instagram to share a picture from the sets of 'Shehzada' and said that he slept for 10 hours after filming the "epic climax" of the upcoming movie. "One of the most difficult, hectic and again a new zone for me," he added. The film, being directed by Rohit Dhawan, will also star Kriti Sanon.

79.title: Kapil confirms new season of 'The Kapil Sharma Show', drops his new look
79.article_body: Comedian-actor Kapil Sharma on Sunday shared his new look and announced that he will soon return to the television screens with the new season of 'The Kapil Sharma Show' (TKSS). The show went on hiatus after Kapil and his team went on a tour to USA and Canada, and Australia. The new season will reportedly air from September onwards.

80.title: Pakistan would've taken 50 overs to chase Zimbabwe's 161 runs: Danish Kaneria
80.article_body: Ex-Pakistan spinner Danish Kaneria has said despite losing wickets at regular intervals during their chase of Zimbabwe's 162-run target, India had an attacking approach. "Many Pakistani fans have said that India lost five wickets while chasing 162...[but] they finished the game within 25 overs. In a similar situation, Pakistan would have taken 50 overs to chase it down," stated Kaneria.

81.title: Police arrest 3 attempting ATM theft in Pune's Nigdi
81.article_body: Three people were arrested by Pimpri-Chinchwad police for attempting to break into an ATM in Nigdi. The accused, identified as Rajendra Popat Bade, Krishna Rajput and Shashank Ghodeswar, were under the influence of alcohol when they attempted the robbery, said Assistant Police inspector S Karode. The accused, he added, were labourers who did not know how to operate an ATM.

82.title: Pune city reports a decline in COVID-19 testing numbers
82.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) limits reported a decline in COVID-19 testing samples. The PMC collected 24,162 samples in August and 12,848 samples in July, which is less compared to previous months. Dr Ashish Bharti, chief, PMC health department, said, "Following a drop in COVID-19 cases and the festive season, many patients are not keen on getting tested."

83.title: No guilt or remorse: Bilkis Bano's lawyer after release of 11 rapists
83.article_body: Bilkis Bano's lawyer Shobha Gupta, while commenting on the release of the 11 convicts, who were sentenced to life imprisonment for gangraping Bano, said there was no guilt or remorse. "Honestly, I don't believe it [remission of 11 convicts] can be treated as a precedent for other rapists and murderers in jail," Gupta said.

84.title: Gotabaya can return to Sri Lanka but must face action: Oppn party
84.article_body: Sri Lankan Opposition party Samagi Jana Balawegaya said that while ex-President Gotabaya Rajapaksa can return to Sri Lanka, he must be tried for allegations of misuse of funds as he doesn't enjoy legal immunity. The party's remarks came as Rajapaksa's cousin said that the ex-leader will return to country soon. Rajapaksa, however, has reportedly applied for a US Green Card.

85.title: No regrets about it: Neha Kakkar on being trolled for crying on TV
85.article_body: Singer Neha Kakkar, speaking about being trolled for crying in reality shows, has said, "We don't see too many people who can feel others' pain and who want to help them." She added, "I have that quality in me and I have no regrets about it." The singer is set to judge the upcoming reality show 'Indian Idol 13'.

86.title: If someone thinks I can change team in a day, then we're living in fool's kingdom: Shakib
86.article_body: Bangladesh T20I captain Shakib Al Hasan has said he has "no goals" for the team ahead of the Asia Cup. "My only aim is we can do well in the T20 WC...If someone thinks I can change things within one or two days...then we're living in a fool's kingdom," stated Shakib. "We've...to make a new start in T20Is," he added.

87.title: Japanese PM Kishida tests positive for COVID-19, recuperating
87.article_body: Japanese PM Fumio Kishida tested positive for coronavirus on Sunday, a Cabinet spokesperson said. Kishida took a PCR test after he developed a cough and fever on Saturday, the Cabinet spokesperson added. The PM's office said that Kishida, who'd just returned from a week-long vacation, is currently recuperating at his official residence. Japan recorded 2,53,248 new coronavirus cases on Saturday.

88.title: Kuldeep seemed confused if he should bowl fast or slow vs Zimbabwe: Kaif
88.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Mohammad Kaif has said spinner Kuldeep Yadav seemed confused about the speed at which he should bowl in the second ODI against Zimbabwe. "However, the rhythm is being seen. He bowled well in WI. He'll get better when he plays more matches," added Kaif. Kuldeep registered figures of 1/49 in his eight overs in the second ODI.

89.title: People have started saying it's 'paap' not AAP: BJP's Gaurav Bhatia
89.article_body: Criticising the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP), BJP spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia on Sunday said that the people have started saying it’s not AAP, it’s "paap" (sin). "The people of the country are saying that if there is any big corrupt...it is Manish Sisodia and AAP," Bhatia added. His remark came after CBI raided Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia’s residence on Friday.

90.title: Man hacked to death near his house in Hyderabad's Chandrayangutta
90.article_body: A man identified as 25-year-old Abu Bakr Al-Amoodi was reportedly hacked to death near his residence in Hyderabad's Chandrayangutta during the early hours of Sunday. Amoodi was spotted lying in a pool of blood by locals who informed the police. Police recovered a dagger from the crime scene. An individual named Abdul Rahman has been identified as the suspected killer.

91.title: No errors in treatment given to Jayalalithaa at Apollo: AIIMS panel
91.article_body: A report by the All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) has given clean chit to Apollo hospital where former Tamil Nadu CM Jayalalithaa was admitted before her demise. The medical panel of AIIMS said that the treatment provided to Jayalalithaa was as per “correct medical practice" and no errors have been found in the procedure.

92.title: Rakesh Tikait detained ahead of farmers' protest at Jantar Mantar
92.article_body: Delhi Police detained farmer leader Rakesh Tikait while he was on his way to Jantar Mantar to participate in a protest against unemployment. Tikait was stopped by the police at Ghazipur. After the arrest, Tikait tweeted, "Delhi Police working at the behest of the government cannot suppress the voice of the farmers. This arrest will bring a new revolution."

93.title: Restoration of Peshwa structure in Pune nears completion after 18 yrs
93.article_body: The Vishrambaug Wada, which is one of the last structures built by Peshwas in Pune, will finally be fully open to public as restoration works are expected to conclude soon. The works, which began in 2003, cost the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) ₹8 crore. "Restoration has to be done with patience and taking care of minutest details," an official said.

94.title: Shefali Shah tests negative for COVID-19
94.article_body: Actress Shefali Shah has informed her fans that she has tested negative for COVID-19. "I'm absolutely fine, and can resume work now," she wrote in a note, which she shared on Instagram. She thanked the doctors and her fans for their "prayers, concern and love". She asked fans to stay safe and take care of themselves.

95.title: Tiger Shroff's 'Screw Dheela' put on hold due to high budget: Report
95.article_body: Tiger Shroff's upcoming film 'Screw Dheela' has reportedly been put on hold due to budget issues and average response to the film's announcement video. "Screw Dheela is not shelved. The team hopes to visit this film later when the box office environment is conducive," a source quoted by Bollywood Hungama said. Filmmaker Shashank Khaitan is attached to direct the film.

96.title: Saba criticises KL Rahul's decision to bowl first in 2nd ODI vs Zimbabwe
96.article_body: Saba Karim criticised India captain KL Rahul's decision to bowl first in India's five-wicket win against Zimbabwe in second ODI, saying he was expecting India to bat first. "They again took the logical kind of route," he added. "The reason why we were out of...T20 World Cup [2021] was because of our conservative approach while batting first," he further said.

97.title: Some noticed cracks, decided to vacate: Ex- corporator on Mumbai building
97.article_body: An ex-corporator, while talking about the four-storey building that fell in Mumbai's Borivali recently, said that some families noticed cracks in the building and decided to vacate the flats. "So there wasn't anyone inside when the incident occurred," the ex-corporator said. Fire engines and fire brigade officials had rushed to the spot after the building had collapsed.

98.title: Sixth accused arrested for stripping girl in UP
98.article_body: The sixth perpetrator involved in UP’s Hamirpur incident, where a girl was stripped and assaulted by a group of men, was arrested. All accused, including two minors, were arrested based on the incident’s video, which went viral on social media. The woman was assaulted after she was allegedly caught with a man in a forest near the culprits’ village.

99.title: PMC announces competition to improve roads for safe commute to school
99.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has planned to implement innovative methods to enable students to commute independently to and from school by making roads safer for them to walk and cycle on, as well as reducing traffic congestion. PMC has announced a competition for urban designers to find 'implementable ideas'. The civic body has reportedly allotted ₹1 crore for the initiative.

100.title: Only trying to harm B'wood: Taapsee on KRK's tweet on Dobaaraa's collection
100.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu has reacted to Kamaal R Khan's tweet over the box office collection of 'Dobaaraa'. She retweeted Hansal Mehta's tweet where he shared a screenshot of KRK's tweet and wrote Bollywood "created these monsters by sucking up to them". Reacting to it, Taapsee wrote, "These people who have relevance...because of the films, are...trying to harm the industry."

101.title: David Warner returns to BBL after 9 years, says 'My girls want me to play at home'
101.article_body: Australian cricketer David Warner has signed a two-year deal with Sydney Thunder, marking his return to the Big Bash League (BBL) after nine years. "My girls have told me...they'd love to watch me play at home and in the BBL," he said. "It will be great for us to be a part of the BBL as a family," Warner stated.

102.title: Blinkit starts printouts delivery at ₹9 per page, Twitter users react
102.article_body: Zomato-owned Blinkit has started a printout delivery service in Gurugram, charging ₹9 per page for black and white printing and ₹19 for coloured with an additional charge of ₹25 on each such order. Reacting to this, a Twitter user wrote, "My local xerox shop owner does it at ₹1/page." Another also wrote, "I’ll get a printer at home."

103.title: Nitish enjoys 'immense goodwill', 'strong candidate' for PM: Tejashwi
103.article_body: Amid reports that Bihar CM Nitish Kumar could emerge as a PM candidate, RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav on Sunday said that Kumar is a "strong candidate" for the post as he enjoys "immense goodwill". Kumar has over 37 years of vast parliamentary and administrative experience, plus he enjoys immense goodwill among his peers, Tejashwi said.

104.title: What did rebel Sena MLAs get by backstabbing us?: Aaditya Thackeray
104.article_body: Shiv Sena MLA Aaditya Thackeray on Saturday asked what the rebel party MLAs got by "backstabbing" the party leadership when it supported them in every possible way. Thackeray on Wednesday claimed that "trapped" legislators in the CM Eknath Shinde-led faction of the party were contacting supporters of Uddhav Thackeray, after the expansion of the Maharashtra cabinet.

105.title: British woman left with 'plastic' forehead after falling asleep in sun for 30 minutes
105.article_body: A 25-year-old British woman named Sirin Murad woke up to find her forehead looking like plastic after falling asleep for 30 minutes in the sun at Sunny Beach in Bulgaria. "No matter how much you think that you’ll be fine or that your skin will not burn, always apply sunscreen!" she said. The temperature at the beach was around 21°C.

106.title: Teacher fired over her cat's appearance in online class wins ₹4.6 lakh payout in China
106.article_body: A teacher who was fired after her cat appeared during an online class has won 40,000 yuan (over ₹4.6 lakh) in an unfair dismissal case in China. The art teacher was conducting an online class last year when her cat jumped into the camera's view five times. The edtech company fired her citing the cat's sudden appearances as a reason.

107.title: I feel embarrassed by it: Vijay Deverakonda on being called superstar
107.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda has said that he always wanted to be called a superstar in the film industry. However, he added, "It has suddenly started feeling a little awkward to me, I am feeling embarrassed by it. Maybe at some point...I don't think I have done enough to deserve it yet." The actor will next feature in 'Liger'.

108.title: Kids who were born after its release are loving it: Vatsal on 'Taarzan...'
108.article_body: Actor Vatsal Sheth has said that his film 'Taarzan: The Wonder Car', which was released in 2004, was way ahead of its time. "Kids who were born recently are watching it and loving it. This is a great quality of the film," he added. Vatsal further said 'Taarzan: The Wonder Car' is the "number one film on television".

109.title: Japan considers deploying 1,000 missiles to counter China: Report
109.article_body: Japan is considering the deployment of 1,000 long-range cruise missiles to increase its capacity to counter an attack from China, the Japanese newspaper Yomiuri reported. The missiles would be capable of reaching North Korea and China's coastal areas, it said. In July, Japan had identified China, Russia and North Korea as its main security concerns in a defence white paper.

110.title: Air India starts more flights on Mumbai-Bengaluru route
110.article_body: Air India has started operating additional flights between Mumbai and Bengaluru. With this, the total number of flights running between the two metro cities has increased to four. Air India had announced 24 additional domestic flights starting August 20 and the new flights between the two metros are part of it.

111.title: Need to eradicate caste system, adopt zero tolerance for prejudice: Meira Kumar
111.article_body: Former Lok Sabha Speaker Meira Kumar said the caste system needs to be eradicated and stressed on adopting "zero tolerance" for prejudice. Her statement comes after a nine-year-old Dalit boy was allegedly beaten to death by his teacher in Rajasthan’s Jalore. "Caste system is an illness. Atrocities related to caste often lead to crippling of the soul," Kumar added.

112.title: Freebies are never free; inform voters of its impact: RBI MPC member
112.article_body: Freebies are never free and political parties offering such schemes must be required to make the financing and trade-offs clear to voters, RBI Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) member Ashima Goyal said. This would reduce the temptation towards "competitive populism", she added. Freebies come at the cost of low quality health, education, air and water that hurt poor, she further added.

113.title: Outgoing Meta COO Sheryl marries businessman Tom Bernthal, shares pic
113.article_body: Outgoing Meta COO Sheryl Sandberg tied the knot with businessman Tom Bernthal and shared their picture on Instagram. Sharing the same photo, Bernthal wrote, "After both experiencing losses, Sheryl and I weren't sure we would ever find love again. Over the last three years, we've merged our lives and blended our families. Our wedding...was a dream come true."

114.title: World no. 28 Kvitova reaches 40th career singles final at Cincinnati Open
114.article_body: World number 28 Petra Kvitova entered her first final at Cincinnati Open after beating 2019 champion Madison Keys 6-7(6-8), 6-4, 6-3 in the semi-final on Saturday. Overall, this is Kvitova's 40th career singles final. Kvitova will face unseeded Caroline Garcia, the first-ever qualifier to reach the final of a WTA 1000 tournament. Garcia defeated sixth-seeded Aryna Sabalenka 6-2, 4-6, 6-1.

115.title: Crawley still learning his game, I believe in him: Brendon McCullum
115.article_body: England's Test team head coach Brendon McCullum has said their opener Zak Crawley, who hasn't crossed the fifty-run mark in his last 14 Test innings, is a talented batter who's still learning. "Crawley is still learning his game at this level. That'll take some patience and persistence," stated McCullum. The 24-year-old scored 22 runs in the first South Africa Test.

116.title: Houses, roads damaged; working to bring back normalcy: U'khand CM Dhami
116.article_body: Uttarakhand Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami said many houses, roads and bridges have been damaged amid heavy rainfall in the state. "Many people are injured and missing. Our priority is to make sure medical aid reaches injured persons; search & rescue operations are underway...There has been a lot of damage to infrastructure. We're working to bring back normalcy," he added.

117.title: Truck hits crowd, cars at accident site in Turkey; 20 killed
117.article_body: At least 20 people were killed after a truck crashed into two cars and ploughed through emergency responders and a crowd gathered at an accident site in Turkey's Mardin on Saturday, according to Turkish Interior Minister Suleyman Soylu. He added that 26 people were injured. This is the second such accident to take place in Turkey on the same day.

118.title: Gurugram couple booked for cheating woman of ₹3.75 cr in bogus land deal
118.article_body: A husband and wife were booked for allegedly cheating a woman of ₹3.75 crore on the pretext of a land deal, which turned out to be bogus, in Gurugram's Manesar. The victim, Sunita Yadav, alleged that the accused, Sandeep Yadav and Manju Rani, had sold her an already mortgaged plot. Sunita alleged that her husband died because of getting cheated.

119.title: Whole thing of two actresses having jealousy is b******t: Shefali Shah
119.article_body: Actress Shefali Shah has said, "I take immense pride in working with all the women I have worked with till now." "This whole thing of two actresses fighting or having jealousy is b******t," she added. Shefali recently shared screen space with Vidya Balan in 'Jalsa' and Alia Bhatt in 'Darlings'. Shefali will next feature in season two of 'Delhi Crime'.

120.title: Kejriwal kingpin of excise policy 'scam', will get handcuffed soon: BJP
120.article_body: The BJP on Sunday alleged that Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal is the "kingpin" of the excise policy "scam", adding that handcuffs are getting close to him. "Roots of the excise policy 'scam' lead to the doorstep of corrupt Kejriwal. No one is above law and no corrupt person will be spared," said BJP spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia.

121.title: Age only a number: Priyanka Chaturvedi shares Dahi Handi video of elderly woman
121.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Priyanka Chaturvedi shared a video on Twitter in which an elderly woman can be seen climbing up the human pyramid for Dahi Handi celebration. Sharing the video, Chaturvedi wrote, "Age is only a number we count until we're old enough to know it doesn't count ~ Katrina Mayer. This video proves that! #DahiHandifestival is truly all encompassing."

122.title: Mehbooba Mufti claims she’s been put under house arrest, shares pics of locked gates
122.article_body: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti on Sunday claimed she has been placed under house arrest again to stop her from visiting the family of Kashmiri Pandit Sunil Kumar Bhat, who was shot dead by terrorists in Shopian. She shared pictures of the locked gates of her residence. Mufti said the Centre's "callous policies" have led to target killings of Kashmiri Pandits.

123.title: Congress to meet in Delhi on August 23 for 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'
123.article_body: Congress will hold a meeting of senior leaders on August 23 in Delhi to discuss about 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'. The party will start the 'Yatra' from Kanniyakumari on September 7 and culminate in Kashmir after 148 days. The Yatra will include padyatras, rallies and public meetings and is scheduled to cover a distance of 3,500 kilometre across over 12 states.

124.title: If films worked due to PM Modi's endorsement, Modi biopic would've been biggest hit: Kher
124.article_body: Talking about criticism that his film 'The Kashmir Files' worked because it was endorsed by PM Narendra Modi, actor Anupam Kher said, "If films worked due to PM Modi's endorsement, Narendra Modi biopic would have been the biggest blockbuster." "Not many people tweeted about 'The Kashmir Files', but a lot of people tweeted about the recently released films," he added.

125.title: Govt issues high severity warning for Google Chrome, asks users to update it
125.article_body: The government's CERT-In recently issued a 'high' severity rated warning for Google Chrome for Desktop, warning users about multiple vulnerabilities. The CERT-In said that the vulnerabilities exist in Chrome versions prior to 104.0.5112.101 and urged users to update their browser. Google has also confirmed existence of the security flaws and said they have been fixed in the latest Chrome update.

126.title: Security personnel being killed due to Tripura govt’s negligence: Manik Sarkar
126.article_body: After a BSF head constable was killed in Tripura, ex-CM and Opposition leader Manik Sarkar said the security personnel are being killed in state due to "negligent attitude" of the state government in combating insurgency. "The state government cannot ignore...responsibility of this loss of life," Sarkar added. "The state government should stand with...martyred BSF jawan in all ways," he stated.

127.title: Gujarat CM reshuffles Cabinet, takes charge of Revenue Ministry
127.article_body: Ahead of Assembly elections, the Gujarat government has reshuffled the Cabinet. The Revenue Ministry has been taken away from Rajendra Trivedi while the Road and Building Ministry has been taken away from Purnesh Modi. CM Bhupendra Patel will be holding both Ministries. Harsh Sanghavi, meantime, has been appointed Minister of State (MoS) with responsibility for the Revenue Ministry.

128.title: UP BJP leader beaten up by wife after getting caught with a woman; video surfaces
128.article_body: A BJP leader, identified as Mohit Sonkar, was beaten up by his wife and in-laws after they allegedly saw him in his car with another woman in Uttar Pradesh. In a video of the incident, his wife and mother-in-law could be seen beating him with slippers. ACP Babupurva, Alok Singh, said that an FIR will be registered after proper investigation.

129.title: Ishan needs to know how to make the best use of his chances: RP Singh
129.article_body: Ex-India pacer RP Singh has said India batter Ishan Kishan needs to make the best use of the chances he's getting at the international level. "It's not that Ishan will not get more chances...but if your performances are not good, you'll slowly-slowly start going out," added Singh. Ishan scored six runs off 13 deliveries in the second ODI against Zimbabwe.

130.title: Amit Shah to address rally in Telangana ahead of Munugode by-polls
130.article_body: Union Minister Amit Shah will be addressing a public rally in the Munugode Assembly constituency of Telangana at around 5 pm today. The by-poll is being held after Congress MLA Komatireddy Raj Gopal resigned from his post and joined BJP. Shah is further scheduled to attend another meet at Ramoji Film City after which he will fly back to Delhi.

131.title: People will give Look Out Circular to BJP after 2024 polls: Sisodia
131.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia criticised PM Narendra Modi over the alleged CBI Look Out Circular issued against him and claimed that after the 2024 Lok Sabha polls people will give a Look Out Circular to the BJP. "It’s unfortunate that the PM keeps thinking against whom should a CBI Look Out Circular be issued today," said Sisodia.

132.title: 3 journalists booked in MP over story on elderly man taken to hospital on cart
132.article_body: Three journalists in Madhya Pradesh have been booked over a story on a family taking an elderly man to a hospital on a pushcart due to unavailability of ambulance after a probe found their claim to be false, police said. The journalists identified as Kunjbihari Kaurav, NK Bhatele and Anil Sharma, work as contributors for national and regional news channels.

133.title: Anand Sharma resigns from top Himachal Pradesh Congress post
133.article_body: Congress leader and former Union minister Anand Sharma on Sunday resigned as the Chairman of the party's Steering Committee for the Himachal Pradesh Assembly polls. In a letter to the party chief Sonia Gandhi, Sharma reportedly said that his self-respect is non-negotiable. However, he has assured that he will participate in campaigns for the Congress candidates.

134.title: 1,000 Congress workers to touch feet of 1 lakh people in Telangana
134.article_body: Ahead of the Munugode bypolls, Telangana Pradesh Congress Committee President Revanth Reddy said that 1,000 party workers will touch feet of 1 lakh people. "Telangana gained independence on September 17. We have scheduled a programme from this very auspicious day to inform the public about the Congress party. The programme is called 'Prajaswamyam ki Padabi Vandanam',” said Reddy.

135.title: Vaishno Devi Yatra resumes after being suspended over bad weather
135.article_body: The pilgrimage to Vaishno Devi Shrine in Jammu and Kashmir's Katra resumed on Sunday morning after being temporarily suspended twice in the previous 24 hours owing to bad weather. "Police and Central Reserve Police Force have already been deployed. The situation is being monitored. No untoward incident has been reported so far," the Shri Mata Vaishno Devi Shrine Board said.

136.title: Woman abuses, hits security guard at Noida society; video goes viral
136.article_body: A video has been widely circulated on social media that showed a woman abusing and assaulting a security guard at a society in Noida. The woman allegedly got into an argument with the guards over a delay in opening the gates. She was also heard telling the guards to "respect women". Meanwhile, the police have registered an FIR against her.

137.title: Italian artist who duct-taped banana to wall & sold it as artwork for $120,000 sued
137.article_body: Italian artist Maurizio Cattelan, who had duct-taped a banana to a wall and sold it as artwork for $120,000 at Art Basel Miami, has been accused by California-based artist Joe Morford of copying his 2000 artwork title 'Banana & Orange'. Cattelan named his artwork 'Comedian'. A Florida court has ruled that Morford can move forward with a case against Cattelan.

138.title: How does 'tomato flu' spread as number of cases in India cross 80?
138.article_body: According to Lancet, children are at an increased risk of exposure to 'tomato flu' which can spread through close contact. Children are also prone to this infection through the use of nappies, touching unclean surfaces and putting things directly into the mouth. Symptoms observed in children with 'tomato flu' include high fever, rashes, body aches and nausea, among others.

139.title: Uni suspends card services after RBI revises digital lending rules
139.article_body: Bengaluru-based credit and payments fintech firm Uni Cards has temporarily suspended active cards after the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) strengthened scrutiny over digital lending. The startup is suspending Uni Pay 1/3rd Card and Uni Pay 1/2 Card in a phased process. Uni Card, used for urgent payments, will continue to give customers access to credit line through Uni Cash.

140.title: Make better films, stop being arrogant: Rahul Dholakia on B'wood
140.article_body: Filmmaker Rahul Dholakia took to Twitter and listed five things that need to be done by the film fraternity. He tweeted, "1. Make better films. 2. Reduce [cost of production] 3. Reduce ticket prices drastically 4. Not release films on OTT for three months 5. Stop being Arrogant. Be inclusive. Maybe this will help?" Dholakia directed the 2017 film 'Raees'.

141.title: ₹27 cr looted in name of beautification: Akhilesh after 2 died at Mathura temple
141.article_body: After at least two persons died during Janmashtami celebrations at Bankey Bihari temple in Mathura, SP chief Akhilesh Yadav said the incident occurred due to "administrative failure". "The truth is...in the name of beautification…around Shri Bankey Bihari temple of Vrindavan, officials sitting in the Braj Teerth Vikas Parishad...looted ₹27 crore...and devotees didn't get any facilities," he added.

142.title: US-based firm Wayfair's CEO lays off 5% of its global workforce
142.article_body: US-based e-commerce company Wayfair's CEO Niraj Shah has laid off 870 employees after the company's anticipated growth did not materialise. After slashing 5% of its global workforce, the company is looking to make reductions in third party labour costs. The company is expecting layoff costs to range between $30-$40 million, which mainly consists of employee severance.

143.title: Car skids, falls off cliff 500 feet down near Pune; 3 killed, 3 injured
143.article_body: Three people were killed and three others seriously injured after a car they were travelling in  veered off a slippery road and fell off a cliff 500 feet on Pune-Mangaon road on Saturday afternoon. "Primary probe suggests that near Kondethar Sanaswadi village, the driver of the car applied brakes on a slippery patch and could not control it," police said.

144.title: Man sentenced to life plus 375 yrs for killing police officer in US
144.article_body: A man was sentenced to life in prison plus 375 years after he shot and killed a 22-year-old police officer in US' Georgia. The incident occurred when the accused fired an AK-47 at the deceased and other officers who were responding to shots fired in a house and domestic disturbance in 2015. The accused pleaded guilty to the charges.

145.title: Germany's Scholz calls Putin's critic Navalny a 'courageous man'
145.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz praised Russian opposition leader Alexey Navalny who was poisoned with Soviet-era nerve agent two years ago. "I...got to know a courageous man who returned to Russia...to fight for democracy," Scholz said. Navalny, an outspoken critic of Russian President Vladimir Putin, is serving a prison sentence over charges of fraud and contempt of court.

146.title: Xi urged US to prevent Pelosi's Taiwan trip, Biden declined: Report
146.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping held a phone conversation with US President Joe Biden last month, asking him to prevent House Speaker Nancy Pelosi from visiting Taiwan, Washington Post reported. The report added that Biden told Xi he "could not oblige" as US Congress is an independent body of the government. Biden reportedly warned Xi against provocative actions during Pelosi's visit.

147.title: Working with US, EU to get Russian food to world markets: UN
147.article_body: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres said that the UN is working with the US and EU to overcome obstacles to let Russian food and fertilisers reach world markets. He said nations that sanctioned Russia for invading Ukraine made clear that measures did not apply to food and fertilisers. "Getting...food...out of Ukraine and Russia is crucial to calm commodity markets," Guterres added.

148.title: Miss Universe to allow married women, mothers to compete for 1st time in 2023
148.article_body: In a first, the Miss Universe pageant will now allow married women and mothers to participate in the beauty contest in 2023. Until now, it permitted only single women to participate. According to an internal memo, the pageant said, "We...believe that women should have agency over their lives and that...personal decisions should not be a barrier to their success."

149.title: Apple extends repair program for iPhone 12 models with sound issue
149.article_body: Apple has extended its repair program for iPhone 12 models experiencing an earpiece sound issue, now covering them for three years after the first retail sale of the unit. The devices manufactured between October 2020 and April 2021 are eligible for the program. However, iPhone 12 mini and iPhone 12 Pro Max are not covered under it.

150.title: Nearly half of Tigray's population is in severe need of food aid: WFP
150.article_body: Ethiopia's nearly two-year conflict left half of Tigray's population in 'severe' need of food as aid groups struggle to reach due to insufficient fuel supplies, according to the World Food Programme. The report said that half of the pregnant or lactating women are facing malnutrition. The UN agency said even though aid delivery resumed after unilateral ceasefire, malnutrition rate 'skyrocketed'.

151.title: Such things happen, he's coming back after a long time: Kaif on Rahul's 1(5)
151.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Mohammad Kaif has said he is not concerned about KL Rahul's form after the 30-year-old got out after scoring one run off five balls in the second ODI against Zimbabwe. "Such things happen, he's coming back after a long time...It was a pitched-up delivery that came in," stated Kaif. Rahul was playing his first international innings since February.

152.title: At the moment, Axar Patel & Jadeja are on par with each other: Ajay Jadeja
152.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Ajay Jadeja has said Axar Patel is at par with Ravindra Jadeja and the only thing that differentiates them is the fielding. "Axar has added to the batting so much more in the last few years," he added. Ajay further said, "Axar is on his (Jadeja's) back, and it's great for Indian cricket."

153.title: After Wipro, TCS delays variable pay for some employees: Report
153.article_body: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) has reportedly delayed the variable pay for senior employees for the June quarter, days after its rival company Wipro paused variable payouts to mid and senior-level employees. TCS will pay the variable compensation to its employees by August-end now, as per reports. In a statement, TCS said its compensation and bonus cycles are as per plan.

154.title: Ex-BJP Rajasthan MLA who admitted 5 lynchings on camera booked
154.article_body: The Rajasthan Police booked former BJP MLA Gyan Dev Ahuja who was recorded saying that his supporters had "lynched five individuals" for cow smuggling. The case was opened after a video went viral in which Ahuja was asking a group of people to start an agitation against lynching of Chiranjilal Saini, who was allegedly lynched by Mev Muslim community members.

155.title: Pixel owners unable to wirelessly charge after Android 13 update
155.article_body: Some Pixel owners have reported being unable to wirelessly charge after the Android 13 update. Several Reddit posts about the issue were from people using the Pixel 4, 4 XL, 6, and 6 Pro using a variety of wireless chargers. In some cases, the phones do seem to recognise that they are on a wireless charger.

156.title: Indian women still use sieve on Karwa Chauth, unfortunate: Raj minister
156.article_body: Rajasthan minister Govind Ram Meghwal on Saturday said it's unfortunate that even today, women in India see the moon through a sieve on Karwa Chauth and talk about their husband’s long life, while those in China and US are living in the world of science. "A husband never sees a sieve for the long life of his wife," Meghwal added.

157.title: Apple CFO Luca Maestri sells shares worth $16.9 million
157.article_body: Apple CFO Luca Maestri has sold 96,735 shares in the firm for $16.9 million, an SEC filing showed. Maestri carried out two sales of shares on August 17 where one transaction was for 66,390 shares, while the other saw the sale of 30,345 shares. Maestri sold the shares as part of an arranged trading plan adopted by him in 2020.

158.title: Can consider inquiry against ex-PM's portfolios controversy: Aus PM
158.article_body: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said his government could consider launching an inquiry into former PM Scott Morrison for secretly taking charge of key ministerial roles during the pandemic. Albanese would seek Solicitor General's advice over the legality of Morrison's actions. Morrison defended himself by saying he felt the nation's responsibility during the pandemic was his alone.

159.title: Jennifer Lopez, Ben Affleck get married for 2nd time; pics go viral
159.article_body: Jennifer Lopez and Ben Affleck on Saturday got married for the second time at Affleck's Georgia home, days after the couple got married in Las Vegas. Actors Matt Damon and Jason Mewes were reportedly among the guests. This comes amid reports that Affleck's mother was hospitalised after she fell off a dock at the venue a day before the wedding.

160.title: Zelenskyy warns of 'vicious' Russian attack ahead of Independence Day
160.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy warned that Russia might do something "ugly" and "vicious" ahead of celebrations to mark 31 years of independence from Soviet rule. Curfew in Ukraine's second largest city Kharkiv will remain in place for the entire day on Wednesday. Zelenskyy said Ukrainians must not allow Moscow to spread despondency and fear ahead of August 24 events.

161.title: Agencies are being weaponised, Oppn should’ve rallied together: Mufti
161.article_body: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti criticised Congress for agitating against another Opposition party. "Sad that Congress is unable to rise above party interests because AAP is a formidable opponent...At a time when agencies are being weaponised, Opposition should’ve rallied together," Mufti tweeted. Her remark came as the Delhi wing of the Congress called for Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia's resignation.

162.title: List of 100 loan apps used to extort ₹500 crore released as Delhi Police bust racket
162.article_body: Delhi Police's special unit released a list of over 100 loan apps after busting a ₹500 crore extortion racket and arresting 22 people in connection with the case. It was found that the loan apps uploaded user data to China and Hong Kong-based servers. The listed apps include Loan Cube, Wow Rupee, Smart Wallet, Giant Wallet, Hi Rupee, Swift Rupee.

163.title: Did costume rehearsals, look tests: Alia on Bhansali's 'Balika Vadhu'
163.article_body: Alia Bhatt revealed that she had done costume rehearsals, look tests and even danced on 'Dola Re Dola' for Sanjay Leela Bhansali's 'Balika Vadhu'. "When he decided to make ['Balika Vadhu']...I was about nine...he said...'I'll wait a couple of years...make it when you are like a little older', but then I think he dropped the idea altogether," she added.

164.title: Russia's Gazprom to shut natural gas pipeline to Europe for 3 days
164.article_body: Russia will halt natural gas supplies to Europe for three days as Nord Stream pipeline will be shut due to maintenance work at a key compressor station, according to state-owned energy company Gazprom. The shutdown will be between August 31 and September 2, it added. In July, Nord Stream 1 gas pipeline was closed for 10 days for maintenance work.

165.title: Shouldn't we release our movies?: Vijay Deverakonda on boycott B'wood trend
165.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda talked about the boycott Bollywood trends on social media. "I don't know exactly what is their (online trolls) issue and what they want," he stated. Vijay revealed they began working on 'Liger' in 2019. He added, "We've worked hard for three years to make this [film]. Shouldn't we release our movies? Should we sit in homes?"

166.title: Karnataka proposes policy to penalise unnecessary use of water
166.article_body: Karnataka, one of the most water-stressed states in India with reportedly about 61% of it in a drought-prone region, has proposed a new water policy to tackle the challenges. The new policy includes measures like penalties for unwise use of water, restricting groundwater extraction and optimising the use of the state's limited water resources, Water Resources Department officials said.

167.title: 3.5 tons of cocaine found in banana shipments in Ecuador, seized
167.article_body: Authorities have seized around 3.5 tons of cocaine which was found in two banana shipments at separate locations in Ecuador, police said on Saturday. One of the shipments, which contained 2,300 cocaine packets, was intercepted by police as it approached the port city of Guayaquil. The other shipment had 1,218 cocaine packets. The containers were bound for UK and Netherlands.

168.title: Mahakal priests urge Zomato to withdraw 'offensive' Hrithik ad, company apologises
168.article_body: Priests from Ujjain's Mahakal temple urged Zomato to withdraw its recent advertisement featuring actor Hrithik Roshan as it offended Hindu sentiments. In the ad, Roshan was seen ordering a 'thali' from 'Mahakal'. Apologising for it, Zomato said that while the ad referred to a thali from Ujjain’s Mahakal Restaurant and doesn't involve Shree Mahakaleshwar Temple, it's now no longer running.

169.title: Mumbai pharmacy worker assaulted over power disruption during Dahi Handi
169.article_body: A 25-year-old pharmacy worker was allegedly dragged out and assaulted by some people over disruption of electricity during a 'Dahi Handi' event in Maharashtra's Nallasopara. One of the accused, Raju Shelar, told the victim that the pharmacy had allowed organisers to take power supply from the shop but it was disrupted. The victim said Shelar pelted a stone at him.

170.title: Gaikwad, Tripathi are waiting, it'd be unfair if they don't get a game: Uthappa
170.article_body: Veteran Indian batter Robin Uthappa has said it would be unfair if Ruturaj Gaikwad and Rahul Tripathi, who are part of the squad for the Zimbabwe series, don't get to play in the third and final ODI. Uthappa further said Deepak Chahar might return for the final ODI. Deepak had registered figures of 3/27 in the first game.

171.title: Over ₹1 cr to be spent on Hyderabad's Khairatabad Ganesh idol
171.article_body: More than ₹1 crore will be spent on preparation of Hyderabad's Khairatabad Ganesh idol, which will reportedly be tallest Ganesh idol in India this year. The committee has decided to install eco-friendly idol made of clay instead of POP. "Artists have come from Chennai to do clay work. 50-100 people are working here on this idol," a devotee said.

172.title: Child dies after brain-eating amoeba enters nose while swimming in river in US
172.article_body: Health officials in the US confirmed that a child died from a rare infection caused by a brain-eating amoeba called naegleria fowleri after swimming in a river in Nebraska. People are usually infected with the amoeba when water containing it enters the body through the nose while swimming in or diving into lakes and rivers, according to US' CDC.

173.title: PharmEasy withdraws plan for ₹6,250 crore IPO citing market conditions
173.article_body: PharmEasy's parent company API Holdings has announced that it has withdrawn the draft papers submitted for an IPO, due to "market conditions and strategic considerations". The company had filed the draft papers with the SEBI last year to raise ₹6,250 crore through fresh equity issuance. The online pharmacy startup is now planning to raise funds through a rights issue.

174.title: When I entered the industry, I didn't know anybody: Adah Sharma
