174.article_body: Actress Adah Sharma opened up about her struggles in Bollywood and said she didn't know anyone when she had entered the film industry. "I was like I could act...dance. Of course, I'll get movies. But then you realise, there were no rules," she added. "You realise...if you're not from the industry for opportunities to come, it gets tough," she stated.

175.title: Xiaomi fires over 900 employees amid revenue drop: Report
175.article_body: Xiaomi has reportedly fired over 900 employees as its revenue dropped nearly 20% in the June quarter. A report said that the layoffs account for nearly 3% of Xiaomi’s workforce. Hit by COVID-19 restrictions, the company’s sales fell 20% year-on-year to 70.17 billion yuan, marking a decline from its previous quarter when it posted its first revenue drop since listing.

176.title: Mahindra shares viral post on Rakesh Jhunjhunwala's advice, calls it 'worth billions'
176.article_body: Anand Mahindra has shared a viral post on late billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala's old interview, wherein he said his worst investment had been his health and urged others to "invest the most in that". "Rakesh gave the most valuable and profitable investment advice ever. It's advice that is worth billions...it requires investing your time, not your money," Mahindra said.

177.title: BJP will do better in 2024 if Kejriwal becomes Opposition's PM face: Assam CM
177.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said that BJP would win by a better margin if AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal is projected as Opposition's PM candidate in the next general election. "People in many states do not know Kejriwal and his party. It would be very good for BJP...as most people haven't even heard his name," Sarma added.

178.title: Tsitsipas beats world no.1  Medvedev to enter final at Cincinnati Open
178.article_body: World number seven Stefanos Tsitsipas defeated world number one Daniil Medvedev to reach the final for the first time at the Cincinnati Open. Tsitsipas won with a scoreline of 7-6(8-6), 3-6, 6-3 in the semi-final. He will face Croatian Borna Coric in the summit clash. Notably, it was only the third time that Tsitsipas defeated Medvedev in their 10-match history.

179.title: Twitter employees may get only half of their annual bonus, warns company
179.article_body: Twitter has warned employees they may only receive half of their annual bonuses, the company confirmed to The New York Times. In an email to staff, CFO Ned Segal said Twitter's financial challenges will affect the annual bonuses they receive. Twitter's bonus pool is currently at 50% of what it could be if Twitter met its financial targets, he added.

180.title: People said 'You're such a b**ch': Barkha on reaction to her 'Masaba...' role
180.article_body: Actress Barkha Singh, speaking about people's reaction to her performance in 'Masaba Masaba 2', has said, "Almost everyone close to me had a similar reaction, 'Wow Barkha, you're such a b**ch'." Barkha revealed her introduction scene in the series was also her audition scene. "I'd give credit to Masaba Gupta, she made sure that I was feeling easy," she added.

181.title: Every morning Centre wakes up, starts CBI-ED game: Arvind Kejriwal
181.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal tweeted on Sunday that every morning the central government "wakes up and starts this CBI-ED game". This comes as CBI issued a Look Out Notice against Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia and others. The central government should work with state governments to fight unemployment and inflation, instead, "they are fighting with the whole country," he added.

182.title: Build democracy where differences in identities & opinions are respected: CJI
182.article_body: CJI NV Ramana urged the people to build a democracy filled with vibrancy and idealism, where differences in identities and opinions are respected. "Don’t allow corrupt thoughts. Don’t tolerate injustices. Be sensitive to the needs of the community and society," CJI Ramana said on Saturday. The CJI further said that the people should have faith in the judiciary.

183.title: Chemical tanker crashes into cargo ship off the coast of Japan
183.article_body: A chemical tanker crashed into a cargo ship off the coast of southwestern Japan on Saturday, the coast guard said. None of the 20 crew members on board the two vessels were injured in the incident. The cargo ship had initially begun to sink after some oil leaked from its engine but it was brought under control, an official said.

184.title: UP minister returns without attending event as college doesn't open gate
184.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Higher Education Minister Yogendra Upadhyaya returned from the entrance of a college in Agra without attending an exhibition as the college gate wasn’t opened for him. The minister reportedly waited for 15 minutes and returned "seemingly irritated". Meanwhile, the college administration has ordered a probe into the incident and sought an explanation from the organisers.

185.title: Alia Bhatt reveals she was paid ₹15 lakh for her debut film 'Student Of The Year'
185.article_body: In an interview, actress Alia Bhatt revealed she was paid ₹15 lakh for her debut film 'Student Of The Year'. "I...deposited the cheque to my mother and very nicely I said, 'Mumma you handle the money.' And till date, my mother handles my money," she said. Alia added she doesn't know how much money she has in her bank account.

186.title: WhatsApp may allow users to recover messages deleted by mistake: Report
186.article_body: WhatsApp is working on a feature to allow users to recover messages deleted by mistake when they tap 'delete for me' instead of 'delete for everyone', WABetaInfo reported. The feature will allow users to restore a deleted message by clicking undo on a bar that will be shown to them for a few seconds after they have deleted a message.

187.title: People are not accepting B'wood due to its hypocrisy, arrogance: Vivek
187.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri, in a statement, has said that the people have seen through the "hypocrisy" and "arrogance" of Bollywood and now people are unwilling to accept it. "Go to any middle-class, urban, semi-urban household and interview them and you will find how people hate the arrogance, glossy lifestyle and the disconnect of Bollywood with real-life audiences," he added.

188.title: BJP is saying it will bring Eknath Shinde in T'gana, topple our govt: KCR
188.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Saturday claimed that BJP is saying it would bring down his government in Telangana. "The BJP is saying that they will bring Eknath Shinde here and topple our government. Who will do this? You are saying this because of your arrogance," CM Rao added. "No section benefitted under PM Modi's rule," Rao stated.

189.title: Mumbai local train services to be hit as Railways to carry out mega block
189.article_body: Mumbai local train services will be hit on Sunday as Central Railway and Western Railway zone will carry out mega block on its suburban sections for maintenance works. Harbour line passengers have been permitted to travel via Main line and Western Railway from 10 am to 6 pm and special locals will run on Panvel-Kurla section during the block period.

190.title: Want permanent peace with India, war not an option: Pakistan PM
190.article_body: Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif has said that Pakistan wants to have "permanent peace" with India through dialogue as war is not an option for either of the countries to resolve the Kashmir issue. Sharif also said that sustainable peace in the region was linked to the resolution of the Kashmir issue as per UN resolutions.

191.title: Noida Police issues traffic advisory after Tyagi community calls 'mahapanchayat'
191.article_body: Noida Traffic Police issued a traffic diversion plan for commuters after Tyagi community called for 'mahapanchayat' today in support of Shrikant Tyagi, a self-proclaimed politician who was recently arrested. The 'mahapanchayat' will take place at Maharishi Ashram Ramlila Maidan. As per the organisers, lakhs of members of the Tyagi community from across western UP will attend the rally.

192.title: Tell me where to come: Sisodia after CBI issues Look Out Notice against him
192.article_body: After CBI issued Look Out Notice against Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia and others in Delhi Excise Policy Scam, Sisodia took to Twitter to say, "All your raids have failed...now you have issued a Look Out Notice...What is this gimmick, Modi ji?" "I'm roaming freely in Delhi, tell me where to come? You can't find me?" his tweet read.

193.title: By the time you get back from pee break, England are all out: Boycott
193.article_body: Ex-England batsman Geoffrey Boycott said it was "madness" for England batters to try and attack South Africa pacers when they were bowling with the new ball in the first Test. "When you watch England face pacers...you don't want to get up...go for a pee because if you do, by the time you get back, they'll be all out," added Boycott.

194.title: 23-year-old Haryana man dies by suicide over alleged delay in visa for Canada
194.article_body: A 23-year-old man in Haryana died by suicide over an alleged delay in his student visa for Canada. After being missing for two days, his body was recovered from a canal in Kurukshetra. While his visa arrived a day after he went missing, as per an acquaintance, he had been upset ever since his friend's visa to Canada came.

195.title: Delhi people to get missed call, WhatsApp options to register choice for power subsidy
195.article_body: The Delhi government will release a phone number with missed call and WhatsApp options for city residents to choose if they want to continue availing free electricity scheme from October 1. "Delhiites will also have...convenience of opting in through a QR (Quick Response) code on the bill or by visiting the discom centre," Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia said.

196.title: Ford unveils concept car with digital floor, glass roof & chess piece controller
196.article_body: Ford Motor has unveiled a futuristic concept car modelled after its Lincoln brand's first luxury vehicle. The Lincoln Model L100 has a glass roof, reverse-hinged doors and a 'digital floor' featuring a large screen that can be personalised. The autonomous vehicle also replaces the traditional steering wheel with a jewel-inspired chess piece controller and allows changes in seating configurations.

197.title: Delhi Excise Policy best of its kind: Deputy CM Manish Sisodia
197.article_body: The Delhi Excise Policy 2021-22 was the "best" of its kind and would have earned ₹10,000 crore every year had the ex-LG not been "asked" to change his decision at the last minute, Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said on Saturday. His statement comes after CBI conducted a raid at his residence in connection with the excise policy case.

198.title: Wish to work with Nawazuddin Siddiqui, he's wonderful: 'KGF' actor Yash
198.article_body: Actor Yash, who featured in the 'KGF' franchise, was asked which Bollywood actor would he work with. To this, he replied, "I wish to work with Nawazuddin Siddiqui. I feel he is a wonderful actor." Nawazuddin is known for movies like 'Gangs Of Wasseypur' franchise, 'Manto', 'Mom'. Nawazuddin will feature in 'Tiku Weds Sheru'.

199.title: SpaceX Dragon spacecraft returns from ISS with 4,000 pounds of cargo
199.article_body: An uncrewed SpaceX Dragon cargo spacecraft has returned from the International Space Station with over 4,000 pounds of valuable scientific experiments and other cargo. With this, SpaceX completed its 25th cargo resupply mission to the space station. SpaceX launched the mission in July and delivered 5,800 pounds of science experiments, crew supplies and other critical cargo.

200.title: UP lawyer booked for stalking woman judge, peeping into her office
200.article_body: A woman judge posted in Uttar Pradesh's Hamirpur lodged an FIR against a lawyer for allegedly harassing and stalking her, the police said. The lawyer allegedly followed the judge on walks wearing matching clothes and passed lewd remarks. The judge further told police that lawyer Mohammad Haroon peeped into her office through a hole in the wall and messaged her.

201.title: Look Out Circular issued against Sisodia, others in Delhi Excise Policy Scam: Report
201.article_body: Days after CBI conducted raids at several locations in connection with Delhi's Excise Policy scam, probe agency has now issued Look Out Circular (LOC) against all accused named in the scam, reports said. A Look Out Circular has also been issued against Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia. Those named in scam have been restricted from travelling abroad, officials said.

202.title: Daughter of Russian Prez's ally called 'Putin's brain' killed in car blast: Report
202.article_body: Daria Dugina, the 29-year-old daughter of Russian President Vladimir Putin's close aide and philosopher Alexander Dugin, has died in a car explosion in Moscow, according to state media. It is not clear if Alexander Dugin, who's known as 'Putin's brain', was the intended target. Unverified videos of the scene shows a car on fire with Alexander Dugin watching in shock.

203.title: Debina & I are in happy space: Gurmeet on being trolled over 2nd pregnancy
203.article_body: Actor Gurmeet Choudhary has reacted to him and his wife Debina Bonnerjee being trolled after announcing second pregnancy four months after having their first child. "I don't pay heed to trolls as they are everywhere...they criticise everyone...Debina and I are in a very happy space. Only we know our truths," he stated. Gurmeet added he never reads the comments.

204.title: It didn't work out: Rahul on his 1st international innings since February
204.article_body: Team India stand-in captain KL Rahul, who got dismissed after scoring one run off five balls in the second ODI against Zimbabwe, said he needed "some time in the middle" in the game but "unfortunately, it didn't happen". Rahul was playing his first international innings since his 49-run outing against the West Indies in an ODI in February.

205.title: 2 Russians, 1 Ukrainian try to enter Albanian military plant, held
205.article_body: Two Russian nationals and one Ukrainian national were arrested after they tried to enter a military plant in central Albania, the country's Defence Ministry said on Saturday. "The officers who were guarding the plant reacted immediately, but during their efforts...two of our soldiers were injured," it added. Albanian PM Edi Rama said that the trio are "suspected of espionage".

206.title: Justice done can quickly be undone if people don't have right discourse: SC judge
206.article_body: Supreme Court judge Justice DY Chandrachud said that justice done can quickly be undone if people do not continue with the right discourse to safeguard the interests of marginalised groups. "I am merely questioning the discourse that class actions (lawsuits) in courts are the only way to meaningfully claim the rights in public spaces?" Justice Chandrachud added.

207.title: Fraudster uses BEST GM's profile pic, texts employees to extort money
207.article_body: Several Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport (BEST) employees received a 'friendly text' on WhatsApp from a number which claimed to be their General Manager Lokesh Chandra and tried to extort money. The WhatsApp number would have Chandra's profile picture and the modus-operandi would be an excuse that he is about to step into an important meeting and urgently require money.

208.title: Pak media watchdog bans live broadcast of Imran Khan's speeches
208.article_body: The Pakistan Electronic Media Regulatory Authority (PERMA) on Saturday banned the live broadcast of former PM Imran Khan's speeches after he threatened police and a female magistrate in a speech. The media watchdog said that Khan's recorded speeches will be aired only after an effective delay mechanism is put in place to ensure effective monitoring and editorial control.

209.title: 20-yr-old man makes minor girls beg at Pune signal, takes their money; booked
209.article_body: A 20-year-old man has been booked for making two minor girls beg at a traffic signal in Pune. A team of the Social Security Cell saw the accused with the girls at the traffic signal, police said, adding that he was making the girls beg and was taking money himself. The girls were rescued and sent to a children's home.

210.title: IAS officer lists how to use newspapers for preparation of civil services exam
210.article_body: IAS officer Awanish Sharan listed things people could read in newspapers to prepare for civil services exam. "Read one Hindi/English national newspaper. Focus on editorial page. Read for maximum 1-2 hours. Don't make a habit of making notes from newspaper. Read Yojana, Kurukshetra, Frontline with any one monthly magazine (Chronicle/Darpan)," the officer tweeted in Hindi.

211.title: It is cheating: Wipro Chairman on employees moonlighting in tech industry
211.article_body: Wipro Chairman Rishad Premji took to Twitter to criticise the practice of 'moonlighting' by employees in the tech industry. "There is a lot of chatter about people moonlighting...This is cheating - plain and simple," Premji tweeted. Moonlighting refers to the practice of employees working on a second job, in addition to one's regular employment.

212.title: Didn't force teacher to resign: St Xavier's VC amid controversy over her Insta pics
212.article_body: St Xavier's University Vice-Chancellor Father Felix Raj said the college didn't force any teacher to resign over her Instagram posts. He added, "She was on probation. She served us...for two months…There's no question of force. There were some unpleasant developments, of course." The teacher had alleged that she was forced to resign over her private bikini pictures posted on Instagram.

213.title: 22 die in Himachal Pradesh amid rains, landslides; IMD issues orange alert
213.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued an orange alert for Himachal Pradesh after 22 people were killed in the state due to heavy rainfall and landslides since Friday. An official said that maximum damage has been reported from Mandi, Kangra and Chamba districts and that 36 weather related incidents have been reported from the state so far.

214.title: Mumbai Police detains barber after receiving '26/11-style' terror threat
214.article_body: The Mumbai Police detained a barber from Virar for questioning after several WhatsApp messages were received on Mumbai's Traffic Control Room number, warning of a '26/11 like' terror strike. The barber hails from UP and had recently shifted to Virar, the police said. The number from which threats were issued, had a Pakistan series sim card, the police added.

215.title: Bowled in right areas, didn't think about wickets: Siraj on his 1/16 in 2nd ODI
215.article_body: Revealing his plan after India's five-wicket win against Zimbabwe in second ODI, India pacer Mohammed Siraj said his plan was to hit an area consistently without worrying whether he'll get wickets or not. "Just wanted to keep hitting the right areas and bowl dot balls to build up pressure on the opposition," he added. Siraj posted bowling figures of 8-2-16-1.

216.title: Bus hits emergency teams in south Turkey, 15 killed
216.article_body: At least 15 people were killed and nearly two dozen were hurt after a passenger bus hit emergency personnel working at the site of an earlier road accident in southern Turkey on Saturday. Two journalists, two paramedics and three firefighters were among the deceased. The remaining deaths were of the occupants of the bus, Turkish Interior Minister Suleyman Soylu said.

217.title: ATS arrests man from Shirdi in Amritsar IED case
217.article_body: The Maharashtra Anti-Terrorism Squad has arrested a man from Shirdi in connection with the case of placing a bomb under the vehicle of Punjab Police sub-inspector Dilbagh Singh in Amritsar. The joint operation between the Squad and the Punjab Police led to his arrest. Earlier this week, Punjab Police arrested two people from Delhi.

218.title: Delhi police bust extortion racket worth ₹500 crores, 22 arrested
218.article_body: Delhi Police have bust an instant loan-cum-extortion racket amounting to over ₹500 crores and arrested 22 people from across the country in connection to it, officials said on Saturday. Chinese nationals are the masterminds of this racket, they said. The extorted money would be routed out of the country through hawala and cryptocurrencies.

219.title: US scholar Chomsky, others urge SC to free Teesta in Gujarat riots case
219.article_body: Top international scholars, including American linguist Noam Chomsky, have urged Indian Supreme Court to free activist-journalist Teesta Setalvad and ex-DGP RB Sreekumar in the 2002 Gujarat riots case. The SC "unfairly" attributed ulterior motives to the two while dismissing their plea, their statement read. "We're dismayed by the recent tendency discernible in the...[court's] judgment," it added.

220.title: To win more Slams, break longest world no. 1 record: Djokovic on his goals
220.article_body: Stating his "clear goals", 21-time Grand Slam champion Novak Djokovic said he believes that he can win more Grand Slams and can break the longest world number one record. With total 373 weeks, Djokovic holds the record for spending the most number of weeks atop the ATP rankings. Steffi Graf held the top spot for 377 weeks, an all-time record.

221.title: Mother fell unconscious during bombing: Djokovic on 1999 Serbia war
221.article_body: Novak Djokovic said his family getting caught in the 1999 war in Serbia is one of his "most traumatic experiences". Novak said the sudden bombings around their then house led to his mom hitting her head and falling unconscious. The tennis star's father took charge, got Novak's mother up and the family grabbed what they could to escape the area.

222.title: Gujarat records 258 new COVID-19 cases, 3 deaths
222.article_body: Gujarat added 258 fresh cases to its COVID-19 tally on Saturday, a state health department official informed. The state also recorded three deaths due to the infection, the official added. As many as 637 recoveries were also recorded. Gujarat's active caseload declined to 2,553 on Saturday from 2,935 on Friday.

223.title: No quick solution to extremely heavy F1 cars: Max Verstappen
223.article_body: F1 championship leader Max Verstappen says there is no quick solution to reducing the weight of the cars, which is currently the heaviest in the sport's history. "They're extremely heavy, which I think is not great...overall, the following and stuff has been a bit better," said the Red Bull racer. F1 drivers have complained that the heavy cars are sluggish.

224.title: 18-yr-old Bihar girl consumes poison as boyfriend refuses to marry her
224.article_body: An 18-year-old girl consumed poison on Thursday in Bihar's Bhojpur district after her boyfriend mocked her and refused to marry her following a consensual physical relationship, local media reported. The girl's mother said that she was in a relationship with a young man for two years. The victim, identified as Priyanka Kumari, is currently in a hospital.

225.title: Man survives after 12-foot alligator bites his head in US, incident caught on camera
225.article_body: A Florida man survived an alligator attack after the 12-foot reptile bit his head. Juan Carlos LaVerde was swimming in Lake Thonotosassa, Florida on August 3 when the incident took place. Aerial footage shows the alligator headed straight for the ex-member of the US Air Force Pararescue, who was working on an instructional video at the time of the attack.

226.title: Waqar Younis says 'Shaheen's injury a big relief for Indian top-order batters', gets trolled
226.article_body: Reacting to Pakistani pacer Shaheen Afridi getting ruled out of Asia Cup, ex-Pakistan captain Waqar Younis tweeted, "Shaheen’s injury [is a] big relief for the Indian top-order [batters]." Younis was trolled by Indian fans for his remark. "If one player's absence makes a team clueless...then that team's...a joke," wrote a fan. "Will you decide by just one match?" another wrote.

227.title: Just fantastic: Graeme Smith on India playing Tests under Kohli
227.article_body: Former South Africa captain Graeme Smith said "it was just fantastic" to see India take Test cricket seriously under Virat Kohli's captaincy. "India led [the] way in Test cricket under Kohli. It was just fantastic," said Smith. Considering the level of competitiveness, he added that only five or six nations might be able to play Test cricket currently.

228.title: Former UK minister endorses Rishi Sunak's candidacy in PM race
228.article_body: Senior Conservative Party MP Michael Gove on Saturday endorsed Rishi Sunak's candidacy for the post of the UK's Prime Minister. Gove branded the tax reduction plans of Liz Truss, who is Sunak's opponent in the PM race, as a “holiday from reality”. “I know what the job requires. And Rishi has it,” Gove wrote in ‘The Times’ newspaper.

229.title: I am telling you no bowlers want to bowl to Kohli when he crosses 15-20 runs: Chahal
229.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli, leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal said, "If he's there at the crease and has 15-20 runs behind him...I'm telling you no bowler wants to bowl to him." He added, "You just see his average across...formats...problem is we just think about his hundreds, we don't talk about those valuable contributions of 60-70 because of the standards he has set."

230.title: Karnataka logs 1,713 fresh COVID-19 cases, 4 deaths
230.article_body: Karnataka logged 1,713 new cases of COVID-19 with a positivity rate of 5.33% on Saturday, the state health department said. Four deaths due to the infection were also reported. Two deaths were reported from Dharwad district while one fatality each was recorded in Bengaluru Rural and Mysuru. Karnataka's active case tally stood at 10,452, as per the daily COVID-19 bulletin.

231.title: Chhattisgarh govt to set up English medium colleges in every district
231.article_body: The Chhattisgarh government has decided to set up English medium colleges in every state district over the next three years. The institutes will be named as Swami Atmanand English Medium Model Colleges, CM Bhupesh Baghel said. Notably, the move is aimed at encouraging native students to pursue higher studies in the state and reduce parents' financial burden, an official said.

232.title: Plan made in UAE to smuggle 500-kg drugs from Pak: NIA on Guj drug case
232.article_body: National Investigation Agency's fresh chargesheet in the Salaya drug seizure case revealed that the conspiracy to smuggle 500-kg heroin from Pakistan to Gujarat in 2018 was hatched in Dubai, UAE. It said the heroin, costing ₹1,500 crore in the international market, was to be further delivered to Punjab for raising funds by a Pakistani national and to harm Indian youths.

233.title: 13 injured in bus-oil tanker collision in Himachal's Kangra
233.article_body: A collision between a private bus and an oil tanker in Himachal Pradesh's Kangra district on Saturday left 13 passengers injured, officials said. According to officials, the accident took place at Sadwan in Nurpur sub-division. The injured were rushed to Civil Hospital Nurpur, officials added. One of the injured has been referred to Tanda hospital, a Civil Hospital official said.

234.title: Ayan worked for 7 yrs on Brahmastra, hope it reaps rich dividends: Karan
234.article_body: Karan Johar, producer of the upcoming film 'Brahmastra' starring Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt, has said director Ayan Mukerji "worked tirelessly" for seven years on this project. "I hope that reaps rich dividends because everyone has put their blood, sweat and tears into every frame of the magnitude of Brahmastra," he added. 'Brahmastra' is set to release on September 9.

235.title: Would be tempted to give Dhawan a go in India's T20 WC squad: Reetinder
235.article_body: Reetinder Singh Sodhi said India opener Shikhar Dhawan doesn't seem to be in the scheme of things in T20Is, but his consistency over the past couple of months has been incredible. "If I'm a selector, I'd be tempted to give him a go in India's T20 World Cup squad," he added. Dhawan last played in a T20I in July 2021.

236.title: 31 killed as heavy rains lash Himachal, Uttarakhand & Odisha
236.article_body: Flash floods, landslides and house collapses triggered by incessant rains claimed at least 31 lives across the country on Friday and Saturday. The most fatalities were from Himachal Pradesh where 22 people were killed, followed by Uttarakhand (4), Odisha (4) and Jharkhand (1). As many as 743 roads were out of bounds for traffic in Himachal Pradesh.

237.title: Alia Bhatt to add Kapoor to her name, says 'I don't want to feel left out'
237.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt, who got married to actor Ranbir Kapoor in April, said in an interview that she will add Kapoor to her name. "I don't want to be the Bhatt while the Kapoors are travelling together. I don't want to feel left out," she added. However, the actress cleared that her screen name will remain Alia Bhatt.

238.title: Spurs' Harry Kane sets PL record for scoring most goals for a club
238.article_body: Tottenham Hotspur striker Harry Kane set a Premier League record as the highest goalscorer (185) for a club during the 1-0 victory against Wolverhampton Wanderers on Saturday. The goal was also Spurs' 1,000th Premier League goal at home and Kane's 250th goal for the club across all competitions. The win takes Spurs to the top of the table.

239.title: Makes no sense that there is no first-class cricket during Test series: Cook
239.article_body: After England lost to South Africa in the first Test at Lord's on Friday, former English skipper Alastair Cook pointed out the lack of first-class games during the Test series. "It makes zero sense that there is no first-class cricket going on [in England] for anyone to play when there's a Test match series going on," Cook said.

240.title: Huge megalithic complex of 500 standing stones found in Spain
240.article_body: Researchers have discovered a huge megalithic complex with over 500 standing stones in southern Spain. They were found on a plot of land spanning 1,500 acres that had been earmarked for an avocado plantation in Huelva near the Guadiana River. "This is the biggest and most diverse collection of standing stones grouped together in the Iberian peninsula," a researcher said.

241.title: Anil won't like being called nana, jokes Karan after birth of Sonam's son
241.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar during an Instagram live session on Saturday congratulated actress Sonam Kapoor and her husband Anand Ahuja on the birth of their son. "I can't believe Sonam is a mother now. I don't think Anil (Kapoor) will like being called nana (grandfather) because he's jawaan as hell," Karan said. Sonam and Anand welcomed the baby boy on Saturday.

242.title: Higher institutes losing relevance due to education factories: CJI
242.article_body: CJI NV Ramana said higher learning institutions were losing their social relevance because of the "mushrooming of factories of education". He added that students entered universities with the sole purpose of getting a "highly remunerative and profitable job". Stating he didn't know who to blame for this, CJI Ramana said institutes should "create individuals as meaningful members of society".

243.title: 'Let's fight', tweets Deverakonda as 'Boycott Liger' trends on Twitter
243.article_body: Vijay Deverakonda, who'll be seen in 'Liger', on Saturday tweeted, "When we're correct, when we do our dharma, we don't have to listen to anyone. Let's fight." This comes after '#boycottLiger' started trending on Twitter. Vijay recently spoke on cancel culture and the trend of boycotting Laal Singh Chaddha, saying, "When you...boycott, you're not only affecting Aamir, you're affecting thousands."

244.title: Shaheen tells fan 'Yaar, bas kya karein' after being ruled out of Asia Cup 2022, video viral
244.article_body: Pakistani fast bowler Shaheen Afridi was seen interacting with fans after getting ruled out of Asia Cup 2022. In a video that has gone viral, he was heard telling a fan, "Yaar, bas kya karein?" The fan was then heard saying, "I am feeling very sad." Pakistan are currently touring Netherlands for a three-ODI series.

245.title: India has 75,000 startups, is world's largest startup ecosystem: Nadda
245.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda on Saturday said that India has over 75,000 startups now, making it the world's largest startup ecosystem. "More than 100 (startups) have become unicorns," he said. Speaking at Himachal Pradesh's Nahan, Nadda said that due to COVID-19 pandemic, the global economy slowed down, but even then, India continued to develop at a rapid rate.

246.title: Scotland museum to return 7 ancient artefacts to India
246.article_body: Museums in Scottish city Glasgow have inked an agreement with Indian government to repatriate seven stolen artefacts to India. The antiquities include a 14th Century Indo-Persian sword and an 11th Century carved stone door jamb. Acting Indian High Commissioner to UK Sujit Ghosh said, "These artefacts are...integral part of our civilisational heritage and will now be sent back home."

247.title: We put up a good fight: Chakabva on Zimbabwe's 5-wicket loss in 2nd ODI
247.article_body: After Zimbabwe's five-wicket loss against India in second ODI, Zimbabwe captain Regis Chakabva said his side put up a good fight in Harare. "Last few games we struggled to pick up early wickets...Today we were short of a few runs. We were up for the challenge," he added. India have taken an unassailable 2-0 lead in the three-match series.

248.title: Zimbabwe bowlers came strong at us, posed challenge: KL Rahul
248.article_body: After winning the second ODI on Saturday against Zimbabwe by five wickets, Indian skipper KL Rahul said that the Zimbabwean bowlers came "strong" at them, which was a "good challenge" for Indian batters. "They (Zimbabwe) do have some quality bowlers, I saw that in the previous series against Bangladesh...We are here to play good cricket and win," Rahul said.

249.title: 82 cases of ‘Tomato Fever’ recorded in India: Lancet
249.article_body: India has recorded 82 cases of the 'Tomato Fever' infection known to affect children under the age of five, said The Lancet. First detected in Kerala on May 6, the flu is a rare viral disease that causes red-coloured rashes, skin irritation and dehydration. Treatment requires a doctor's consultation with one of the precautions being to not scratch the blisters.

250.title: NGT orders closure of Murthal eateries violating environmental norms
250.article_body: The National Green Tribunal (NGT) has directed the Haryana government to shut roadside eateries and restaurants that are violating environmental norms in Murthal. A bench headed by NGT Chairperson Justice AK Goel also noted that no effective action has been taken on the ground level  by the authorities and there is unchecked continuing damage to the environment.

251.title: CBI court rejects Mondal's bail plea, extends custody till Aug 24
251.article_body: A special CBI court in West Bengal rejected Trinamool Congress (TMC) leader Anubrata Mondal's bail plea on Saturday in the alleged cattle smuggling scam case. The court extended his custody till August 24. The CBI had appealed for an extension of his custody by stating that Mondal, "a highly influential person", could "influence witnesses and tamper evidence if granted bail".

252.title: 12 IAS officers shifted in Delhi hours after raid at Dy CM's home
252.article_body: Twelve IAS officers of the Delhi government have been transferred within its departments. Special Secretary Health and Family Welfare Udit Prakash Rai, who earlier faced corruption charges, has been transferred to Administrative Reforms Department. The bureaucratic rejig comes hours after Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia's residence was raided by the CBI.

253.title: Apple supplier Foxconn to invest $300 mn more in Vietnam, to create 30,000 jobs: Reports
253.article_body: Apple supplier Foxconn has signed a $300 million memorandum of understanding with Vietnamese developer Kinh Bac City to expand its facility in the north of the country to diversify and boost production, reports said. The Taiwanese company's new factory, on a plot of 50.5 hectares in Bac Giang province, will generate 30,000 local jobs, reports added.

254.title: Congress shares purported clip of BJP leader admitting to lynching
254.article_body: Rajasthan Congress President Govind Singh Dotasra on Saturday shared a video on Twitter in which former BJP MLA Gyan Dev Ahuja purportedly admits that his supporters have "lynched five people". In the alleged video, Ahuja said, "We have so far lynched five people, be it in Lawandi or Behror." Dotasra said the video exposes "the real face of the BJP".

255.title: Elon Musk approaches brain chip implant developer Synchron about deal: Reports
255.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has reportedly approached brain chip implant developer Synchron about a potential deal. This comes as Synchron is ahead of Musk-owned Neuralink in the process to win regulatory clearance for its devices, reports said. Synchron has not decided whether it would accept an investment and no deal is certain, reports added.

256.title: Delhi Police arrest garment seller on terror funding charge
256.article_body: A 48-year-old garment trader based in Delhi's Meena Bazaar has been arrested for alleged involvement in a terror funding operation. Police said Mohammad Yaseen allegedly funded banned groups Lashkar-e-Taiba and al-Badr via hawala transactions. The funds for terror were sent from South Africa to Surat and Mumbai and Yaseen was the link in Delhi, officials said.

257.title: Hooda creates world record for most consecutive wins in international cricket since debut
257.article_body: Team India batter Deepak Hooda on Saturday created world record for most consecutive matches won by a player since debut in international cricket. India have won all their 16 matches in which Hooda has played so far. The previous world record was held by Romania's Satvik Nadigotla (15 consecutive wins since debut).

258.title: Even base price of an IPL player is more: Ashwin on Zimbabwe T20 league's prize money
258.article_body: Talking about pay disparity, Team India all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin stated that Zimbabwe T20 league's total prize money of $10,000 (over ₹8 lakh) is even less than what a base price of an IPL player is. Referring to an article, Ashwin said, "Wherever there is more money, employment opportunities are better, and there are better chances of players flourishing."

259.title: Enjoying wicketkeeping, batting: Samson on his 43* and 3 catches in 2nd ODI
259.article_body: Following India's five-wicket win against Zimbabwe in the second ODI, Indian wicketkeeper-batter Sanju Samson said he is enjoying wicketkeeping and batting. "I think they (Indian bowlers) were bowling [in] really good areas, a lot of balls came nicely to me," he added. Samson, who was adjudged 'Player of the Match', scored 43*(39) and took three catches on Saturday.

260.title: PM Modi should work with states to strengthen economy: Rajasthan CM
260.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Saturday said PM Narendra Modi should take states into confidence and work with them to strengthen the economy. Speaking after inaugurating Rajiv Gandhi Centre of Advance Technology in Jaipur, Gehlot said, "We should be worried about the situation the country is moving towards." "I am seeing such an atmosphere for the first time," he added.

261.title: Greece's 12-year-long EU fiscal oversight ends
261.article_body: Greece's 12-year-long fiscal surveillance by the European Union ended on Saturday with Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis calling it a "historic day". European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen said "the country can close this chapter, and look to the future with confidence". The fiscal surveillance was imposed in exchange for bailout packages after the country faced a debt crisis.

262.title: 2 more ships leave Ukraine under Black Sea grain export deal
262.article_body: Two more ships carrying agricultural products departed from Ukraine's Chornomorsk port under the Black Sea grain export deal signed last month, Turkey said on Saturday. This takes the number of ships to leave Ukraine under the pact to 27. Ukraine's Sea Ports Authority on Saturday said that three seaports had begun loading 66,500 tonnes of agricultural products onto seven ships.

263.title: PM Modi's govt has surrendered to China's threats: Subramanian Swamy
263.article_body: BJP member Subramanian Swamy has alleged that the PM Narendra Modi-led Centre has "surrendered to China's threats". "The two Babus turned Cabinet level advisors to [PM] Modi make India swallow all humiliation. Even Galwan Hill has been gifted as was Kailash Hill," Swamy tweeted. "Depsang had been lost earlier...[But PM] Modi will not name China," he added.

264.title: Heavy to very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states, list released
264.article_body: Heavy to very heavy rainfall is likely over Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh and Rajasthan between August 20-22. Rainfall is likely over Jharkhand, Odisha on August 20, Maharashtra on August 21-22 and Gujarat on August 23. West Bengal, Goa, J&K, Uttarakhand, UP, Punjab, Haryana, Assam, Meghalaya, Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram, Tripura, Karnataka, Tamil Nadu and Kerala are also likely to receive rainfall.

265.title: Roger Federer has inspired me in many ways: Novak Djokovic
265.article_body: Praising Roger Federer, world number six Novak Djokovic said the 20-time Grand Slam champion has inspired him in many ways. "Roger has particularly showed, not just me but all the generations after him, how efficiently and smartly you can train...in order to be a champion...how to...carry yourself on the court with dignity and everything," he added.

266.title: BJP alarmed by Kejriwal's popularity: AAP leader on CBI raid on Sisodia
266.article_body: Punjab Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) spokesperson Malvinder Singh Kang on Saturday alleged that the growing popularity of Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal had alarmed the BJP, causing it to "misuse" the CBI. Kang was commenting on CBI's raid at Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia's residence. The 2024 general election is clearly a battle between PM Narendra Modi and Kejriwal, Kang said.

267.title: Monkeypox virus can stay on common household items for days: Study
267.article_body: A study by the US's Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) has found that monkeypox virus can stay on many common household objects for several days. Researchers said around 70% of household items like couches, blankets, a coffee machine, computer mouse and light switches were found infected with the virus even after disinfection. None of them, however, were alive.

268.title: Employee shot dead outside sub-divisional court in Bihar's Motihari
268.article_body: A 45-year-old employee of a sub-divisional court was shot dead at its entry point by two bike-borne assailants in Bihar's Motihari on Saturday, a police officer said. The victim, Sanjay Thakur, was entering Areraj sub-divisional court premises around 10.30 am when the incident took place, the sub-divisional police officer said. Four empty cartridges were recovered from the spot, he added.

269.title: Hard for SA, Aus to not make it: Watson predicts WTC finalists for 2021-23
269.article_body: Predicting World Test Championship (WTC) finalists for the cycle 2021-23, ex-Australia all-rounder Shane Watson said, "It's going to be hard for South Africa and Australia to not make it. They're both playing really good cricket." He added, "You can never discount India and Pakistan because they've got so many match winners outside of their home countries as well."

270.title: Don't want to be known as Alia Bhatt's doppelganger: Celesti Bairagey
270.article_body: Celesti Bairagey, who made her acting debut in show 'Udti Ka Naam Rajjo', has said she doesn't want to be known as Alia Bhatt's doppelganger. "People say...I resemble her, and I feel happy because...in a way, I'm being called cute. The problem arises when it starts becoming your identity...I'd never be happy if 'lookalike' tag becomes my identity," she added.

271.title: People from Pakistan always welcome me with a lot of love: Boman Irani
271.article_body: Actor Boman Irani in an interview said that cinema unites people, adding, "I don't know anything that unites people as much and that's why Bollywood is popular across Pakistan." "Whenever I've met people from Pakistan, be it in any part of...world, they always welcome me with a lot of love which brings a smile to my face," he added.

272.title: 12 injured in Russian missile strike near nuclear plant: Ukraine
272.article_body: A Russian missile hit a residential area of a southern Ukrainian town, Voznesensk, not far from the Pivdennoukrainsk Nuclear Power Plant on Saturday, Ukrainian officials informed. According to officials, 12 civilians, including four children, were wounded in the strike. "It is possible that this missile was aimed specifically at the Pivdennoukrainsk Nuclear Power Plant," Ukraine's Energoatom said.

273.title: Sonam Kapoor poses for Vogue cover during her pregnancy, pic goes viral
273.article_body: Sonam Kapoor, who welcomed a baby boy on Saturday, has featured on Vogue's cover. The cover, shot during Sonam's pregnancy, shows her with her baby bump. "Priorities do change and I think that the child will become mine. The truth...is...they didn't choose to come into this world. You decided to bring them here, so it's a...selfish decision," she told Vogue.

274.title: Would like Chahar, Bhuvneshwar to play together in T20Is: Sodhi
274.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Reetinder Singh Sodhi has said that he would "like to see" seamers Deepak Chahar and Bhuvneshwar Kumar playing "together" in T20Is "if conditions suit them". "In T20Is, you can be a genuine wicket-taker if you have the ability to move the ball both ways and...[Chahar along with Bhuvneshwar] can make...early dents into the opposition's batting order," Sodhi added.

275.title: Earth narrowly escapes collision with 420-foot-wide asteroid: NASA
275.article_body: A 420-foot-wide asteroid 2019 AV13, which was approaching Earth, has flown past the planet, missing it narrowly on Saturday, NASA said. The giant asteroid came 5.2 million km close to the Earth but didn't deviate towards it. Had it struck the planet, the asteroid would've caused huge disaster, flattening a radius of a few kilometres accompanied by earthquakes and tsunamis.

276.title: Chandigarh airport to be named after Shaheed Bhagat Singh: Punjab CM
276.article_body: The state governments of Punjab and Haryana have agreed to rename Chandigarh International Airport after freedom fighter Shaheed Bhagat Singh, Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann said on Saturday. "Had a meeting with Haryana Deputy Chief Minister Dushyant Chautala on this issue today," Mann added.

277.title: 30,225 animals in Haryana infected with lumpy skin disease; 211 dead
277.article_body: At least 30,225 animals in eight districts of Haryana have been infected with the lumpy skin disease. Haryana Chief Secretary Sanjeev Kaushal on Saturday gave directions to the officials concerned to ensure 100% vaccination of cattle within the next seven days across the state. Of the 30,225 infected animals, 211 have died and 16,939 have recovered, a government spokesperson said.

278.title: In pics: From Jupiter to Earth, images taken by NASA's Voyager spacecraft
278.article_body: After 45 years of service, NASA is planning to shut down the Voyager spacecraft. During their course, the two Voyager spacecraft have travelled farther than any man-made object. It has captured amazing photos of several celestial bodies, including Saturn and its three moons, Jupiter's Great Red Spot, Earth and the moon, Uranus and Jupiter's second largest moon Callisto, among others.

279.title: Maha ATS files case against unknown persons in AK-47-boat case
279.article_body: Maharashtra Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) has registered a case under the Arms Act against unknown persons, in connection to the boat that was found with AK-47 rifles off Raigad coast on August 18. The Navi Mumbai unit of ATS is investigating the case, an official said. The yacht with rifles and ammunition was found off the coast by local fisherfolk.

280.title: BJP sole party that works to make country, not government: Rajnath Singh
280.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said BJP is the "sole party that does not function to make the government but to make the country". He was inaugurating the party's new 'Panchkamal' office in Haryana's Panchkula. Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar, also present at the event, said the building was not just "a party office but a temple".

281.title: Death toll from fire tragedy at Thai nightclub rises to 20
281.article_body: The death toll due to a fire that broke out at a nightclub in Thailand's Chonburi province on August 5 has risen to 20, Thai health officials said. Authorities had recovered 13 charred bodies from the site of the tragedy. As many as 25 injured are still receiving treatment, with nine of them on ventilators, the local health authority said.

282.title: Chahar is a bit lower in the pecking order in T20Is: Saba Karim
282.article_body: Former India cricketer Saba Karim said that he feels that seamer Deepak Chahar is a "bit lower" in the pecking order in T20Is even when "fully fit". "You have...Jasprit Bumrah and the experience of Bhuvneshwar Kumar and also youngsters like Avesh Khan and Arshdeep Singh. Chahar has improved...but he has been expensive at the death," Karim said.

283.title: Kejriwal, Sisodia to travel to Gujarat next week for poll campaign
283.article_body: Amidst the CBI case against Delhi's excise policy irregularities, CM Arvind Kejriwal said he and Deputy CM Manish Sisodia will visit Gujarat next week. Kejriwal said they will travel with the message that if voted to power, Gujarat will get free and quality education as well as healthcare services. Assembly elections in Gujarat are due in the next few months.

284.title: TMC leader stabbed to death in West Bengal; 4 detained
284.article_body: A Trinamool Congress (TMC) leader named Alam was stabbed to death in West Bengal's South 24 Parganas district on Saturday morning. Police said they have detained four people in connection with the murder. As per Times Now, Alam was allegedly shot at before being stabbed multiple times in Basanti town. The motive for the attack is yet to be ascertained.

285.title: 2 women electrocuted while cutting grass in a field in UP's Etah
285.article_body: Two women were electrocuted to death while cutting grass in a field in Chhitauni village in UP's Etah district. The deceased, Chandravati (55) and Usha Devi (60), died when a high-tension wire broke and fell on them, police said. Notably, the villagers demanded that the district administration and the electricity department provide financial aid to the families of the deceased.

286.title: Terror threat received by Mumbai Police should be taken seriously: Ajit Pawar
286.article_body: After Mumbai Police's traffic wing received several text messages on its helpline number threatening a "26/11-like" attack, NCP leader Ajit Pawar on Saturday said these threats should be taken seriously. "The state government should take this threat seriously and our police are very able in such situations," Pawar said. "But central agencies should also look into the matter," Pawar added.

287.title: We named her 'Antim' so we don't get another daughter: U-20 world champ wrestler's mother
287.article_body: Krishna Kumari, the mother of Antim Panghal who became the first-ever Indian woman to bag gold at Under-20 Wrestling World Championships, revealed how they named her daughter. She said, "We named our daughter Antim so...we don’t get another daughter as we got four daughters." "Antim has become Pehli (first) in the wrestling world today," she added about her win.

288.title: Wrestler Antim creates history, becomes 1st Indian woman to win gold at U-20 World C'ships
288.article_body: Wrestler Antim Panghal has created history by becoming the first Indian woman to win a gold medal at the Under-20 Wrestling World Championships. The 17-year-old defeated Kazakhstan's Altyn Shagayeva 8-0 in the final of the 53-kg category to achieve the feat. Antim had also won gold medal at the Asian Junior Championships earlier this year.

289.title: 13 potential regions for landing the next humans on Moon identified by NASA
289.article_body: NASA announced 13 potential landing sites for its upcoming Artemis III mission to return humans to the Moon for first time since Apollo. Each of these regions is located within six degrees of latitude of lunar South Pole. The regions contain sites that provide continuous access to sunlight throughout a 6.5-day period- the planned duration of Artemis III surface mission.

290.title: Extremely painful: Himachal CM over heavy losses due to torrential rains
290.article_body: Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur on Saturday expressed concerns over heavy losses to lives and properties as torrential rains battered the state. "The incidents of untimely death of some people due to heavy rains across the state are extremely painful," Thakur said. He directed the district administrations to ensure relief, rescue and rehabilitation works in the affected areas.

291.title: No new cars, greet everyone with namaste, adab: Bihar Dy CM to ministers
291.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav has issued a series of dos and don'ts to the newly-elected ministerial colleagues of Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD). "Ministers...will not buy any new cars for themselves in the department," his order stated. Yadav also requested the ministers to be courteous towards everyone and promote the tradition of salutation with 'namaste' and 'adab'.

292.title: Zimbabwe bowler's relative asks Chahar 'Can I touch you?' before taking pic, video viral
292.article_body: A video has gone viral showing a relative of a Zimbabwe cricketer asking India cricketer Deepak Chahar, "Can I touch you?" before taking a picture with him. In the video, the woman can be seen laughing once Chahar agrees. "He is very humble...I liked it how accommodating he is," the woman later said.

293.title: I have done this on my own: Kartik on completing 11 years in B'wood
293.article_body: Kartik Aaryan, speaking about completing 11 years in the film industry, said, "I take pride in the fact that I've done this on my own and with...help of people who put their trust in my capabilities without knowing me." "They went for the craft instead of lineage," he added. Kartik will next be seen in films like 'Freddy' and 'Shehzada'.

294.title: Let's turn this sh*t back: Kyrgios on his arrival in New York ahead of US Open
294.article_body: Wimbledon finalist Nick Kyrgios took to Instagram Stories to share a picture of himself on his arrival in New York ahead of US Open 2022 and wrote, "Young Kygs (Kyrgios) in NY (New York). Let's turn this sh*t back." The 27-year-old Australian has never reached beyond the third round of the US Open in eight attempts so far.

295.title: Rajasthan BJP takes out protest march over deteriorating law & order
295.article_body: The BJP took out a protest march in Rajasthan's Jaipur on Saturday against the state government over its failure to maintain law and order. "The law and order situation in Rajasthan has completely deteriorated to which CM Ashok Gehlot has no answer," Rajasthan BJP chief Satish Poonia said. Under his rule, Rajasthan has become a capital of crime, Poonia added.

296.title: RPF rescues 67 live turtles from train in Bihar's Kishanganj
296.article_body: The Railway Protection Force (RPF) on Saturday rescued 67 live turtles from seven unclaimed bags in a coach of Ajmer-Kishanganj Garib Nawaz Express at Bihar's Kishanganj station. "No arrests have been made so far. RPF has informed officials of the district forest department about the recovery of these turtles," RPF Inspector said. Authorities suspect the turtles were poached from Ajmer.

297.title: Train hits 3 walking with earphones in separate incidents in UP; all dead
297.article_body: Three people, walking on railway tracks with their earphones plugged in, died after being hit by different trains in Uttar Pradesh. While the Howrah-Lal Kuan Express mowed Krishna (20) and Monu (18) at railway tracks near Bhadohi railway station, Pankaj (30) was hit by a passenger train on Varanasi-Allahabad railway line. They couldn't hear the train approaching due to earphones.

298.title: A proud moment: Anil as int'l film critic predicts Oscar nomination for RRR
298.article_body: Anil Kapoor tweeted a video of international film critic Clayton Davis praising Rajamouli's 'RRR' and predicting its place in the Oscars nominations. Clayton, who often makes predictions about Oscars and Emmys, called 'RRR' "a monument to action cinema" and said it reminded him of George Miller's 'Mad Max: Fury Road'. Anil wrote, "A proud moment, looking forward to Oscar nomination."

299.title: Indonesia confirms first monkeypox case in foreign returnee
299.article_body: Indonesia reported its first confirmed case of monkeypox in a 27-year-old male on Saturday. The Indonesian national tested positive in capital Jakarta late on Friday, a health ministry spokesperson said. According to the ministry, the man had returned from an unidentified country with documented cases. The patient is doing "well" and showing only mild symptoms, the ministry added.

300.title: It's a sad thing: Dean Elgar on SA being alloted 28 Tests from 2023 to 2027
300.article_body: After South Africa were allotted 28 Test matches in the 2023-27 Future Tours Programme cycle, skipper Dean Elgar said that it's a "sad thing". "I guess we could be playing more...I can't say too much about that because I might get into trouble," Elgar said. South Africa were at the sixth spot while England topped the list with 43 Tests.

301.title: Liquor trader paid ₹1 crore to Manish Sisodia's aide: CBI in FIR
301.article_body: A liquor trader paid ₹1 crore to a company managed by Dinesh Arora, an associate of Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia, the CBI said in its FIR in the excise policy case. Radha Industries received ₹1 crore from Sameer Mahendru of Indospirits, the agency alleged. Arora and others were allegedly involved in managing undue pecuniary advantage collected from liquor licensees.

302.title: 16 dead, 8 missing after flash floods, landslides in Himachal Pradesh
302.article_body: At least 16 people were killed and eight others were reported missing in incidents of landslide, flash flood and cloudburst triggered by heavy rainfall in Himachal Pradesh in the past 24 hours, a senior official said on Saturday. State Disaster Management Department Director Sudesh Kumar Mokhta added that the maximum damage has been reported in Mandi, Kangra and Chamba districts.

303.title: 4 killed, several injured amid heavy rainfall in U'khand; 10 missing
303.article_body: Four people died and several others sustained injuries due to rain-related incidents in Uttarakhand as torrential rain hit parts of the state, forcing people to leave their damaged and flooded houses, officials said on Saturday. Ten people have been reported missing so far. CM Pushkar Singh Dhami inspected the affected areas and instructed officials to ensure a speedy rescue operation.

304.title: Condom pack used to dress woman's head injury at health centre in MP, pic surfaces
304.article_body: A woman's head injury was dressed using a condom pack along with cotton at a health care clinic in Madhya Pradesh. It was discovered when a doctor at a district hospital began to change the dressing of her injury. The dresser from the Porsa Community Health Centre has been suspended by the state health department, officials said.

305.title: 24.5 lakh tickets sold for this year's World Cup in Qatar: FIFA
305.article_body: Around 24.5 lakh tickets for this year's World Cup in Qatar have been sold until now, FIFA said. Football's global governing body informed that the biggest number of allocated tickets were for group stage matches like Cameroon vs Brazil. "Fans living in Qatar, Saudi Arabia, the United States, Mexico, the United Arab Emirates, England, Argentina, Brazil...led the way," FIFA added.

306.title: CWG gold added fresh boost to Sen's confidence: Father ahead of World C'ships
306.article_body: Indian shuttler Lakshya Sen's father DK Sen said his son's gold medal at the recently concluded Commonwealth Games and the bronze medal at the World Championships 2021 have added a fresh boost to his confidence ahead of World Championships 2022. "He will be a great medal contender in Tokyo, this time, as well," he added.

307.title: Delhi court acquits CM Kejriwal, Sisodia in 2013 defamation case
307.article_body: A Delhi court on Saturday acquitted CM Arvind Kejriwal, Deputy CM Manish Sisodia and former AAP leader Yogendra Yadav in a criminal defamation case filed by lawyer Surender Sharma. Sharma had claimed that his candidature from AAP was cancelled in 2013 Assembly elections at the last moment. All three persons were present in the court when the order was pronounced.

308.title: Montenegro govt collapses over pact with Serbian Orthodox Church
308.article_body: Montenegro's coalition government collapsed on Saturday after the country's parliament passed a motion of no confidence against the cabinet of PM Dritan Abazovic. The no-confidence motion was proposed by 36 deputies (members) of the parliament to protest the recent signing of an agreement regulating the position of the Serbian Orthodox Church in Montenegro.

309.title: Those who oppose CAA, don’t understand it: MoS Ajay Kumar Mishra
309.article_body: Union Minister of State for Home Affairs Ajay Kumar Mishra reacted to people's demand for the exemption of the Citizenship Amendment Act and said people opposing CAA are the ones who don't understand it. "CAA is a 1955 law when the then government made...law on citizenship. We've only amended it and [it's]...not applicable to...citizen of the country," he said.

310.title: Heavy security deployed around Hyd venue hosting Munawar Faruqui
310.article_body: Heavy security was deployed around Hyderabad's Shilpakala Vedika auditorium ahead of stand-up comedian Munawar Faruqui's performance on Saturday. BJP members are planning to hold a protest against Faruqui, ANI reported. BJP MLA Raja Singh was detained on Friday for reportedly trying to burn down the auditorium. Earlier, the MLA threatened to beat Faruqui for his alleged comments on Lord Ram.

311.title: India win 14th straight ODI vs Zimbabwe, record their 10th series win of 2022
311.article_body: India defeated Zimbabwe by five wickets in the second ODI in Harare to take an unassailable 2-0 lead in the three-match series. India have now won 14 ODIs in a row against Zimbabwe. Further, India have now won 10 series across formats in international cricket in 2022. The third Zimbabwe-India ODI will take place on Monday.

312.title: World no. 1 Medvedev enters 2nd consecutive semi-final at Cincinnati Open
312.article_body: World number one Daniil Medvedev and fourth seed Stefanos Tsitsipas entered the semi-finals at the Cincinnati Open after defeating Americans Taylor Fritz and John Isner on Friday. Medvedev beat Taylor Fritz 7-6(7-1), 6-3, while Tsitsipas defeated John Isner 7-6(7-5), 5-7, 6-3. Medvedev, who reached his second straight semi-final in Cincinnati, will face Tsitsipas on Saturday.

313.title: Telangana BJP Prez calls for boycott of Munawar Faruqui's Hyd show
313.article_body: Telangana BJP President Bandi Sanjay Kumar called for the boycott of comedian Munawar Faruqui's show to be held in Hyderabad on Saturday. "As if the comedy circus of TRS govt run by a bunch of clowns...isn't enough, now they're bringing Munawar Faruqui," tweeted Kumar. He alleged that Faruqui had demeaned Lord Ram and Goddess Sita in the name of comedy.

314.title: Army team treks 213 km of unexplored Ladakh terrain in 12 days
314.article_body: The Indian Army's 14-member 'Snow Leopard Brigade' completed a trek in Ladakh covering 213 km of unexplored terrain in 12 days. "Trekking expedition from Rumtse to Nyoma through tough terrain with heights ranging from 14,000 feet to 18,000 feet," tweeted Indian Army's Northern Command. In July, an 11-member team trekked 162 km of rugged terrain in Himachal Pradesh.

315.title: Want to discuss Delhi's excise policy in monsoon session: BJP
315.article_body: Leader of Opposition in the Delhi Assembly, Ramvir Singh Bidhuri, on Saturday alleged the CM Arvind Kejriwal-led government had given permission to open liquor vends in non-conforming areas. He demanded the monsoon session be called to discuss the city's excise policy. "While the liquor sales have gone up...the government's revenue from it hasn't. Why so?" he further asked.

316.title: It's my fault, need to understand what people want: Akshay on films' failure
316.article_body: Akshay Kumar, speaking about his recent films not working at the box office, said, "If my films aren't working, it's my fault." "I have to make the changes, I have to understand what the audience wants," Akshay said, adding, "I want to make changes, I want to dismantle my way of working. Nobody else is to be blamed but me."

317.title: Harnaaz teaches B'wood dance steps to comedian Trevor Noah, shares video
317.article_body: Miss Universe Harnaaz Sandhu recently appeared on 'The Daily Show with Trevor Noah' and shared a video from the sets on her Instagram handle. In the video, Harnaaz could be seen teaching some Bollywood dance steps to the show's host and comedian Trevor Noah. "It was such a pleasure to share the stage with one and only @trevornoah," she wrote.

318.title: 25 injured after bus rams into truck in UP's Etah
318.article_body: Twenty-five people were injured after a roadways bus rammed into a stationary truck near Keelramau village in UP's Etah district. All 25 injured people were passengers inside the bus which was travelling from Farrukhabad to Delhi. Notably, the injured have been admitted to the Etah Medical College hospital. According to the passengers, the driver was driving at high speed.

319.title: Pune selected for C40 Cities Bloomberg Philanthropies Awards
319.article_body: Pune city has been picked as a finalist in the 2022 C40 Cities Bloomberg Philanthropies Awards in the “United to clean the air we breathe” category. Pune has been selected in recognition of the electrification of public transport buses in the Pune Metropolitan Area. Pune’s public transport system will have 650 electric buses by the end of 2022, authorities said.

320.title: Bengaluru woman's plan to get husband killed fails; lover dies by suicide
320.article_body: A Bengaluru woman's plan to get her husband killed failed after the contract killers she and her boyfriend had hired sent them a photo that seemingly confirmed the murder. Fearing arrest, Himavanth, Anupallavi's lover, died by suicide while Anupallavi's husband, Naveen, surprisingly returned after two weeks and said that he had befriended the contract killers during his kidnapping, police said.

321.title: 5 arrested for stealing laptops worth ₹6.5 lakh in Noida
321.article_body: A group of five men wanted in connection with multiple theft cases in Noida was arrested for allegedly stealing more than 22 laptops worth ₹6.5 lakh, Noida Police said on Friday. According to police, the accused broke into the premises of two IT companies in Noida's Sector 63 during the early hours of July 30 and stole 27 laptops.

322.title: 40-yr-old Hyderabad man ends life over harassment from loan agents
322.article_body: A 40-year-old man, Ravinder Yadav, allegedly died by suicide in Hyderabad after being harassed over repayment of money he borrowed through online applications. He was employed in a private company and lived with his wife and two children. "In their complaint, relatives alleged Yadav...had obtained loans...and failed to repay it, was being threatened by unknown persons over phone," police said.

323.title: I-T Dept raids J'khand hotel in search of Partha Chatterjee's aide
323.article_body: The Income Tax Department conducted a raid at a hotel in Jharkhand's Hazaribag district in search of an alleged close aide of West Bengal's ex-minister Partha Chatterjee. The department had received input from the Enforcement Directorate that the person was in Jharkhand's Bhandara Park to allegedly hide unaccounted money. He reportedly left the hotel hours before the I-T team arrived.

324.title: Mediation important tool for desperately congested courts: SC judge
324.article_body: Supreme Court judge Justice DY Chandrachud said mediation is an important tool in reducing pendency in the "extremely burdened" and "desperately congested" courts of India. The judge quoted data which said lower courts have pendency of 4.1 crore cases, while high courts have about 59 lakh cases. He said the pandemic has worsened the already alarming pendency in the system.

325.title: BJP leader said one must give ₹2,500 cr for K'taka CM post: Cong MLC
325.article_body: As per a report, Congress MLC BK Hariprasad has alleged that there are too many aspirants for the post of Karnataka Chief Minister and there is "big money" involved. "According to a [senior BJP] leader, one should cough up ₹ 2,500 crore," Hariprasad added. BJP leader Prabhu Chavan said, "This is just a lie. CM's seat is not for sale."

326.title: Don't let older people touch your feet: Tejashwi to RJD ministers
326.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav asked all the RJD ministers not to purchase new vehicles for themselves and not to let those older than them touch their feet. He also encouraged the ministers to exchange pens or books instead of gifting bouquets. "Will promote the tradition of...namaste and adaab with folded hands for greetings," he said.

327.title: 16 arrested in connection with death threat to Cong leader Siddaramaiah
327.article_body: Police on Saturday said 16 persons were arrested in connection with a death threat received by Congress leader Siddaramaiah. "Nine people have been arrested in Kushalnagar and seven in Madikeri, all of whom will be produced before the magistrate court," Kodagu SP said. This comes after Siddaramaiah claimed that he received death threats over his remarks on Veer Savarkar.

328.title: Ishan Kishan mistakenly hits Axar Patel with ball, Axar's angry reaction goes viral
328.article_body: During the second ODI against Zimbabwe, India's Ishan Kishan mistakenly hit Axar Patel with the ball while throwing it back from the deep. Axar covered his head with both his hands while in a crouched position, however, the ball bumped straight into him. Axar was then seen staring at Ishan while seeming to be angry. Ishan then apologised to Axar.

329.title: Pakistan pacer Shaheen Afridi ruled out of Asia Cup
329.article_body: Pakistan fast bowler Shaheen Afridi has been ruled out of the Asia Cup due to an injury to the right knee ligament. The 22-year-old has been advised rest for four to six weeks by the medical team. He had sustained the injury while fielding during the first Test against Sri Lanka in Galle last month.

330.title: Nagaland's NDPP, BJP dismiss merger speculation after 2023 polls
330.article_body: Ruling alliance partners in Nagaland, Nationalist Democratic Progressive Party (NDPP) and BJP, have dismissed speculation that the two will merge after the 2023 Assembly elections. "BJP is a national party...while NDPP is a regional entity with its own principles. There is neither any agenda nor have we held any discussion over merger," NDPP leader Neiba Kronu said on Friday.

331.title: Man held for cheating jewellers of ₹4.2 cr in Mumbai, cash seized
331.article_body: Mumbai Police arrested a 65-year-old man, Srikumar Shankara Pillai, for allegedly cheating jewellers to the tune of ₹4.22 crore by starting a chain of bogus jewellery stores, an official said on Friday. After the key of a BMW was found in his Dombivli residence, police located the car and found ₹2.09 crore in it, the official added.

332.title: 44,900 Russian soldiers killed, 1,907 tanks destroyed so far: Ukraine
332.article_body: Ukraine on Saturday claimed that it has killed around 44,900 Russian soldiers since Moscow's invasion began on February 24. Around 1,907 Russian tanks and more than 430 aircraft, including 197 helicopters, have also been destroyed, Ukraine's Foreign Ministry said. The ministry further estimated that its forces have destroyed 4,212 armoured personnel carriers and 266 multiple launch rocket systems.

333.title: Stand-up comic Munawar Faruqui's show cancelled in Bengaluru
333.article_body: Stand-up comic Munawar Faruqui's show 'Dongri to Nowhere' was cancelled at the last minute on Friday in Bengaluru as the organisers didn't seek permission, police said. It's the second time that Faruqui's show has been cancelled in Bengaluru since November 2021. The cancellation came after a Hindutva outfit reportedly petitioned police, alleging Faruqui had hurt Hindu sentiments in his shows.

334.title: New Zealand floods reminder to protect environment: Prince William
334.article_body: UK's Prince William said that the floods which have ravaged New Zealand are a reminder of the need to "protect the environment". Hundreds of people have been forced to evacuate their homes due to heavy rains and flooding this week. The Mayor of Nelson, which is New Zealand's worst-affected city, said that it could "take years, not months" to recover.

335.title: B'wood created these 'monsters': Hansal after KRK's tweet on Dobaaraa
335.article_body: Reacting to a tweet by actor Kamaal R Khan where he trolled the box office collection of 'Dobaaraa', filmmaker Hansal Mehta termed him a "monster" created by Bollywood. Hansal added Bollywood's getting kicked in the back, having "sucked up to" and "paid" such monsters. "'Dobaaraa'...[ran] with houseful occupancy for entire day...and...collected the huge amount [of] ₹8 lakhs," KRK had tweeted.

336.title: Uttarakhand CM Dhami inspects areas affected by cloudburst in Dehradun
336.article_body: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami visited the areas affected by cloudburst in Dehradun. He instructed the State Disaster Management Department and other administrative officials to be on high alert amid incessant rainfall. He also ordered officers to make alternate arrangements for smooth movement of traffic and to provide immediate relief to the people affected by excessive rains.

337.title: Delhi records over 15 swine flu cases in 2 weeks
337.article_body: More than 15 cases of swine flu (H1N1) have been reported in Delhi in the past two weeks, Delhi government heath officials said on Friday. According to doctors and health experts, the number of swine flu cases might be higher as the symptoms of the infection are similar to COVID-19 and symptomatic patients are not getting tested for swine flu.

338.title: Karnataka's Youth Cong to send eggs to all BJP ministers in protest
338.article_body: After eggs were thrown at former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah's convoy in Kodagu, the state's Youth Congress head Mohammed Haris Nalapad said, "As a mark of protest, we decided to send eggs to all BJP ministers in the state." He added that the BJP is "just trying to disturb the harmony in the state by creating communal tensions".

339.title: 17-yr-old girl raped by maternal uncle in Uttar Pradesh's Mahoba
339.article_body: A 17-year-old girl was allegedly raped by her maternal uncle in Uttar Pradesh's Mahoba district, police said on Saturday. The incident reportedly occurred when the victim had gone to visit her maternal grandparents to celebrate Raksha Bandhan. According to Khanna police station SHO, Radheshyam Verma, the accused also threatened to kill the girl if she informed anyone about the incident.

340.title: Richa Chadha got ₹2 lakh, Huma Qureshi got ₹75,000 for Gangs of Wasseypur: Anurag
340.article_body: Anurag Kashyap revealed he hasn't made a sequel to 'Gangs of Wasseypur' as it's considered a loss-making film by its distributors. He added he feels the cast didn't get paid enough money. "Richa Chadha got ₹2 lakh, Huma Qureshi got ₹75,000...You got a good movie in less money, but when it made money...you should pay people for it," Anurag stated.

341.title: AAP govt is 'revdi' & 'bevdi sarkar': Union Minister Anurag Thakur
341.article_body: After CBI conducted a raid at Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia's residence in connection with the excise policy case, Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Saturday said that the AAP government is both "revdi" (freebies) and "bevdi sarkar" (drunk government). He also questioned, "Manish Ji, if your liquor policy was right, [then] why did you take it back?"

342.title: All CBI officers were great, behaved with my family very nicely: Manish
342.article_body: Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia said that all CBI officers were "great people". "They behaved with my family very nicely. They had to obey orders from high command, but I would like to thank them to have behaved so nicely," Sisodia added. He had earlier said CBI had seized his computer and phone.

343.title: I get mistaken for Priyanka Chopra all the time: She-Hulk's Jameela Jamil
343.article_body: Jameela Jamil, who currently stars in 'She-Hulk: Attorney at Law', said that people mistake her for Priyanka Chopra all the time and called it the 'honour of her life'. Last year, a Twitter user confused Jameela with Priyanka and tweeted, "Did Nick Jonas and Jameela get divorced?" Jameela had responded, "A different Indian woman who doesn't look anything like me."

344.title: Met Police Commissioner for protection, he said 'You don't need it': Kashyap
344.article_body: Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap, who directed 'Black Friday', said he'd met ex-Mumbai Police Commissioner Rakesh Maria for requesting protection after the film's release. "He said, 'You don't need it. [The] underworld loves you'," added Kashyap. Kashyap stated he was also forced to attend a gangster's Christmas party after the release of 'Satya'. "They made me sit on a throne," he said.

345.title: Man throws 11-month-old son into canal due to financial trouble in Raj
345.article_body: A man, facing financial trouble, allegedly threw his 11-month-old son into a canal in Rajasthan's Jalore, police said. He told his wife that he had dropped him off at his father's place, police added. The accused, a Gujarat resident, came to Jalore with his wife and son and asked her to wait at a place near the canal, police stated.

346.title: Inspired by web series, Surat teen buys revolver to impress others; arrested
346.article_body: A 14-year-old boy was sent to a juvenile home after police caught him with a country-made revolver in Gujarat's Surat. The minor told police that watching armed heroes in crime web series inspired him to procure a weapon. So, he bought the revolver during his visit to Uttar Pradesh for ₹6,000 and used it to impress and scare others.

347.title: Sonam Kapoor, Anand Ahuja blessed with a baby boy
347.article_body: Sonam Kapoor and Anand Ahuja were blessed with a baby boy on Saturday. Neetu Kapoor, who co-starred with Sonam's father Anil Kapoor in 'Jugjugg Jeeyo', shared a screenshot of their statement.
