It read, "On 20.08.2022, we welcomed our...baby boy with bowed heads and open hearts. Thank you to...the doctors, nurses, friends and family who have supported us on this journey."

348.title: Karthik is a different type of power player: Mike Hesson
348.article_body: RCB's director of cricket operations Mike Hesson said that Indian batter Dinesh Karthik is a "different type of power player". "Karthik came from the wilderness...[Getting] an Indian finisher was difficult," Hesson said. He added, "There are very few players who are like AB de Villiers...But we watched him (Karthik) closely from overs 15-20 and he did well in those overs."

349.title: I am on BJP's radar for speaking out truth: Siddaramaiah
349.article_body: Former Karnataka CM and Congress leader Siddaramaiah criticised BJP and said that he's on BJP's radar for speaking out the truth. "Those who killed Gandhiji, will they spare me? I tell the truth that's why BJP and RSS people are angry with me. Nathuram Godse killed Gandhiji, it is sad that they worship his portrait," said Siddaramaiah.

350.title: 25-yr-old hammers landlord to death in Delhi, takes selfie, video with body
350.article_body: A 25-year-old man was arrested for allegedly hammering his landlord to death in Delhi. The landlord and the accused had an argument after the latter came home drunk. "After [the landlord] fell asleep, the accused hit him on the head with a hammer. He also took a selfie with the body and took a video of it," police said.

351.title: Pune's Pimpri-Chinchwad civic body to recruit 386 permanent staffers
351.article_body: Pune's Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation has decided to recruit 386 permanent staffers in different departments, officials said. The last date to submit applications for vacancies of permanent staff is September 8, officials added. This comes after the Maharashtra government lifted the ban on recruitment a couple of months ago. "The ban was in force for nearly seven years," officials stated.

352.title: 500 gm of cocaine worth ₹5 cr seized from woman passenger at Mumbai airport
352.article_body: The Customs department recovered 500 grams of cocaine worth ₹5 crore from a woman passenger who arrived at the Mumbai International Airport from Ethiopia, after which she was arrested, officials said. The Customs department in a tweet said that the woman, Bintu Janneh, had arrived from Addis Ababa on Friday, adding that the drug was found concealed in her purse.

353.title: Signed a film & read in paper that somebody else got it, felt terrible: Adah
353.article_body: Actress Adah Sharma recalled her "disappointing" days in the industry and said, "I'd days when I signed a contract for...film and then I read in [a] paper that somebody else had gotten [it]." "I was like how? I felt terrible," she added. "That time it feels like the end of the world...But...you got to be okay with rejections," said Adah.

354.title: US announces new $775 million weapons package for Ukraine
354.article_body: The US has announced a new $775 million weapons package for Ukraine. "President [Joe] Biden has been clear that we'll continue to support...people of Ukraine in defending their country from Russia's aggression for as long as it takes," US State Secretary Antony Blinken said, adding the new package brings the administration's total security assistance to Ukraine to approximately $10.6 billion.

355.title: 4 dams that supply water to Pune city reach full capacity
355.article_body: The four dams that supply water to Pune city have reached full capacity, officials said. On Friday, the Khadakwasla dam released 15,000 cusecs of water, Warasgaon spillway released 3,552 cusecs, Panshet spillway released 1,954 cusecs and Temghar dam released 100 cusecs of water. The total capacity of the four dams is 29.15 thousand million cubic feet.

356.title: If a judge clears 50 cases, 100 more filed: Rijiju on pending cases
356.article_body: With nearly five crore cases pending in courts, Law Minister Kiren Rijiju said that if a judge clears 50 cases, 100 new litigations are filed. This is because people are now aware and approach courts to settle disputes, he added. Rijiju also felt that the situation shouldn't be compared with other countries as "we have a different set of problems".

357.title: Hyderabad Mayor distributes fruits to patients in MNJ Cancer Hospital
357.article_body: Hyderabad Mayor Vijayalaxmi Gadwal on Friday distributed fruits to patients in MNJ Cancer Hospital as a part of 'Swatantra Bharata Vajrotsavam' from August 8 to 22. She also inspected every ward in the hospital. Speaking on the occasion, Gadwal said the state government had constructed night shelters in seven major hospitals for attenders of 862 patients coming from other places.

358.title: Challan for using pressure horns, modified silencers: Delhi Traffic Police
358.article_body: The Delhi Traffic Police took to Twitter to announce that it has begun penalising drivers who put pressure horns and modified silencers in their vehicles starting Saturday. "Challans will be issued to those found creating noise pollution by violating the norms," an official said. Welcoming the move, Delhites also called for action against modified headlights and high beam usage.

359.title: PCMC to soon have parking management system
359.article_body: The Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) is planning to have a parking management system in the city soon. "A holistic approach is needed to resolve the parking issues in the city with a focus on reducing the number of vehicles on the street," an official said. "Also, the focus will be on shifting on-street parking to off-street," he added.

360.title: Pak EC issues notice to Imran Khan over 'contemptuous remarks'
360.article_body: The Election Commission of Pakistan (ECP) on Friday summoned ex-PM Imran Khan for allegedly making "contemptuous" remarks against the poll body. He has been ordered to appear before ECP on August 30. Last month, Imran Khan had urged Chief Election Commissioner Sikandar Raja to resign, stating that his party won the Punjab by-polls despite Raja's attempts to influence the results.

361.title: Spelling of Manish Sisodia's name is now 'MONEY SHH': Anurag Thakur
361.article_body: Following a CBI raid at Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia's residence in connection with the excise policy case, Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Saturday said, "Manish Sisodia might have now changed...spelling of his name too. Now it's - MONEY SHH." He added, "[Sisodia] makes money and maintains silence." He also claimed that AAP was trying to "hide" the excise scam.

362.title: Kiran would try to imitate Dhoni's 2011 WC-winning six everyday: Coach
362.article_body: Talking about Kiran Navgire who recently received her maiden call-up to India's T20I squad for the tour of England, her coach Gulzar Sheikh said she's a "big fan" of MS Dhoni. "Everyday at the nets, she'd try to imitate that 2011 World Cup-winning six," he added. Kiran is the only Indian to score over 150 runs in a T20 match.

363.title: Ginger garlic paste worth ₹5 lakh seized in Hyd; 2 held over adulteration
363.article_body: Two men were arrested in Hyderabad on Friday for allegedly manufacturing adulterated ginger garlic paste. The accused, identified as Mohammed Zaffar Alam and Somnath Chetty, were arrested by Commissioner's Task Force and the central zonal team. Officials seized 650 kg of ginger garlic paste worth ₹5 lakh from them. The accused were detained at Begum Bazar Police Station.

364.title: Bureaucratic reshuffle in Delhi govt, 12 IAS officers transferred
364.article_body: In a bureaucratic reshuffle, 12 IAS officers were transferred within Delhi government. Special Secretary, health and family welfare, Udit Prakash Rai, has been transferred to administrative reforms department as its Special Secretary. IAS Jitendra Narain has been made Chairman and Managing Director of Delhi Finance Corporation and IAS officer Vivek Pandey has been appointed as Secretary (IT).

365.title: 13-yr-old boy dies hours after eating biryani from Hyd restaurant
365.article_body: A 13-year-old boy reportedly died last week, hours after consuming biryani from a restaurant located in Hyderabad's Lakdikapul. His father and sister, who had also consumed the restaurant's biryani for dinner, fell sick and were shifted to a hospital. The family members claimed they ate only biryani the night before the boy died. Police have sent biryani's sample for examination.

366.title: Hard for SA, Aus to not make it: Watson on potential finalists for WTC
366.article_body: Sharing his opinion on potential finalists for the ongoing edition of World Test Championship (WTC), ex-Australia all-rounder Shane Watson said, "It'll...hard for South Africa and Australia to not make it." "You can never discount India and Pakistan...They've got...many match winners," added Watson. "I'd be very surprised if they don't come knocking on the door leading into the final," he stated.

367.title: Twitter tests labelling accounts linked with verified phone numbers: Report
367.article_body: Twitter is testing a label for accounts that are linked with verified phone numbers, according to an image shared by engineer Jane Manchun Wong. As per Twitter's current policy, people can have the same phone number associated with up to 10 Twitter accounts. Further, verified accounts are required to have a verified phone number or email address attached to them.

368.title: Feeling of being called Test cricketer is different: Chahal on Test ambition
368.article_body: Talking about the thought of playing Test cricket for India, spinner Yuzvendra Chahal said the feeling of being called a Test cricketer is completely different. "In my last 10 first-class games I have fifty wickets," he added. The 32-year-old, who made his India debut in June 2016, hasn't made his Test debut so far.

369.title: Lancet warns about 'tomato flu' virus in India that leaves children with red blisters
369.article_body: The Lancet journal has warned about 'tomato flu' virus that has affected children in parts of India. The infection has been named 'tomato flu' because of the red, painful blisters that appear on a patient's body and gradually enlarge to the size of a tomato. It said that the virus is "very contagious" but is considered non-life-threatening.

370.title: 5 killed in wall collapse incidents amid heavy rain in Odisha
370.article_body: Five people, including four children, died and five others were injured in separate wall collapse incidents amid heavy rainfall across Odisha, officials said on Saturday. Two children died and their parents suffered injuries after the mud wall of their house collapsed in Mayurbhanj district. Similarly, a four-year-old girl died in Balasore, whereas a nine-year-old boy died in Koraput district.

371.title: 9-yr-old abducted, raped & killed by villager in Ghaziabad; arrested
371.article_body: A 24-year-old man was arrested for allegedly raping and murdering a nine-year-old girl in Ghaziabad's Modinagar. The accused reportedly abducted the victim and her six-year-old cousin on his bicycle on the pretext of buying them ice cream. He left the younger girl behind and went into a dense isolated spot with the older girl, where he raped and murdered her.

372.title: 3 boys kill man in front of daughter over rivalry with his son in Pune
372.article_body: Three minor boys reportedly hacked a 52-year-old man to death in front of his daughter over an old rivalry with his son in Pune. The incident took place when the deceased had gone to pick up his daughter from school, according to reports. The trio's rivalry with the deceased's son was apparently over a girl in their college.

373.title: Request PM to give justice to Bilkis Bano: Owaisi on release of rapists
373.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi criticised the Centre after 11 convicts in the Bilkis Bano gang-rape case were granted remission. "There is a government circular that says the rapists should not be remitted on Independence Day and BJP has taken the decision against that too. We request PM Modi with folded hands to give justice to her." said Owaisi.

374.title: Mumbai Police constable rapes sex worker after failed raid
374.article_body: A constable of the MHB Police Station allegedly raped a sex worker in Mumbai. The police had conducted a raid to bust a prostitution racket which failed as they could not apply charges of solicitation. Later the accused, Rajratan Kale (42), took the victim to a hotel and allegedly raped her. The complaint was filed at the Kanakia Police Station.

375.title: What is the controversy over IRCTC's tender to monetise passenger data?
375.article_body: IRCTC has floated a tender to hire a consultant to study its customers' personal data with an aim to monetise it, the company's website showed. The tender has sparked concerns regarding the data privacy of customers. As per the tender, the hired consultant will be required to study customer data, including name, mobile number, e-mail ID, and login or password.

376.title: Arrested TMC leader Anubrata taken to hospital for medical check-up
376.article_body: TMC leader Anubrata Mondal, arrested in a cattle smuggling case, was taken for a medical check-up and will later be produced in court today. He was reportedly summoned several times by the CBI to appear for questioning, however, he evaded the summons citing his health. He was arrested on August 11 from his residence in Birbhum, West Bengal.

377.title: UN calls for release of Saudi woman sentenced to 34 yrs for tweeting
377.article_body: The UN Human Rights Office, OHCHR, expressed outrage over a 34-year prison sentence handed down to Saudi student Salma al-Shehab in connection with a series of tweets and retweets on political and human rights issues in Saudi Arabia. "We urge...Saudi authorities to quash her conviction and release her immediately," OHCHR spokesperson Liz Throssell said. The 34-year-old was arrested in 2021.

378.title: Need to ensure cricketing demands are fulfilled more than anything: Pandit
378.article_body: KKR head coach Chandrakant Pandit said he will try to be flexible in his methods while coaching the KKR players but added he will ensure cricketing demands are fulfilled more than anything else. Discussing Pandit's recent appointment, former India opener Aakash Chopra had said, "Pandit scolds the players a lot...Will the same strategy work with the international players?"

379.title: Centre worried about Kejriwal, not corruption: Delhi Dy CM Manish Sisodia
379.article_body: After CBI raided Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia's residence on Friday, the AAP leader accused the Centre of using the investigation agencies to further political motives. "Corruption is not what PM Narendra Modi is worried about...The Centre is just worried about the meteoric rise of...Kejriwal," Sisodia said. "BJP is...using...CBI and ED to implicate Opposition leaders in false cases," he said.

380.title: Woman gets ₹4 lakh compensation after being asked her age at Domino's interview in UK
380.article_body: A woman who was asked her age during a job interview at Domino's Pizza in Northern Ireland's County Tyrone has received an apology and a financial settlement of £4,250 (around ₹4 lakh). She believed she was turned down for the role of delivery driver due to her age and sex. She then filed a discrimination case against the franchise.

381.title: Barcelona star Lewandowski's watch worth ₹56 lakh stolen, thief buries the watch
381.article_body: Barcelona forward Robert Lewandowski's watch worth €70,000 (₹56 lakh) was stolen after he stopped to sign autographs for fans outside the club's practice facilities. The thief opened the passenger door of Lewandowski's car and swiped the watch. Lewandowski tried to chase him but he ran away. Later, police tracked down and detained the thief, who had buried the watch.

382.title: Snap halts work on selfie drone Pixy months after launch: Report
382.article_body: Snap is shutting down development of future versions of Pixy, a drone-powered camera that can record videos and photos to be shared on the Snapchat app, The Wall Street Journal reported. The decision comes less than four months after Snap CEO Evan Spiegel unveiled the device. The company plans to continue selling the current version of Pixy, the report said.

383.title: 2 drivers killed, 10 students injured as K'taka school bus collides with another bus
383.article_body: Two people were killed after a school bus collided with another bus heading in the opposite direction in Athani in Belagavi district of Karnataka. Ten students were also injured in the incident. The incident took place in the early hours of Saturday. Those who lost their lives in the incident include drivers of both the vehicles.

384.title: Flash flood-like situation near Dehradun; video of Tapkeshwar temple surfaces
384.article_body: A flash flood-like situation was reported from various areas in Uttarakhand's Dehradun following a cloudburst. A video from Tapkeshwar Mahadev temple has surfaced online. Tamasa river nearby breached its banks due to continuous torrential rainfall. "Due to this...contact of Mata Vaishno Devi Cave Yoga Temple and Tapkeshwar Mahadev has been lost...pool has been damaged," the temple's founder said.

385.title: JP Nadda to visit poll-bound Himachal to discuss poll strategy
385.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda is set to visit Nahan in Himachal Pradesh to chalk out strategy for the upcoming Assembly elections to be held later this year. "I am on a very emotional two-day visit to Himachal Pradesh. I will get the opportunity to visit Nahan, where I worked for the organisation in my youth," Nadda said.

386.title: CBI's plumes are saffron: Kapil Sibal after raids on Sisodia
386.article_body: Former Congress leader Kapil Sibal called the CBI an "uncaged parrot" after the probe agency conducted raids at Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia's residence. "CBI, once a 'caged parrot' is now uncaged. Now, its plumes are saffron...It parrots what his master says!" said Sibal. Raids were conducted in seven states in connection with the alleged excise policy scam.

387.title: UP university bars over 9,800 students from exams for mass copying
387.article_body: A university in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj has debarred over 9,800 students from giving examinations for a year after they were allegedly found guilty of mass copying during annual examinations, university officials said on Friday. The administration of Prof Rajendra Singh (Rajju Bhaiya) University had conducted surprise inspections during various semester examinations, officials added.

388.title: CJI NV Ramana inaugurates new City Courts Complex in Vijayawada
388.article_body: Chief Justice of India NV Ramana inaugurated the new City Courts Complex in Andhra Pradesh's Vijayawada on Saturday. Built at a cost of ₹100 crore, the complex will house all courts under one roof. It's spread over an area of about 15,000 square metres and has 29 court halls with special chambers for sessions judges and magistrates, among other facilities.

389.title: Educational institutions shut in Himachal's Mandi amid heavy rains
389.article_body: Owing to the incessant rains, all government and private educational institutions except colleges and ITI will be closed throughout Mandi, Himachal Pradesh. Kullu district administration has also announced to shut all the schools and Anganwadi Centres. Heavy rainfall has battered many parts of the state and due to this several roads are blocked.

390.title: 11 arrested in separate cases, including theft, across Bengaluru
390.article_body: The Bengaluru Police on Friday arrested 11 people in separate cases across the city. Ten people were arrested in Bengaluru's Chikkajala area in four different cases of theft, DCP (North East), Anoop A Shetty tweeted. Further, one person was arrested in Devanahalli police station limits for creating fake land documents, Shetty said, adding that he was sent to judicial custody.

391.title: IFS officer shares pic of animal's jaw, asks people to guess name
391.article_body: IFS officer Surender Mehra shared a picture of an animal's jaw and asked people if they could guess its name. He later also shared a picture showing the "full view" of the image. Responding to the officer's tweet, several users of the social media platform commented that it is a "ghariyal".

392.title: Nepal opens its first-ever human milk bank for at-risk infants
392.article_body: Nepal President Bidya Devi Bhandari on Friday inaugurated the nation's first-ever human milk bank at a maternity and women's hospital in Kathmandu. The centre has been established in partnership between the Government of Nepal, European Union and UNICEF. "The milk bank...gives premature...and other at-risk infants access to the vast benefits of breastmilk when they need it the most," UNICEF said.

393.title: Facebook contractors chosen 'at random' by an algorithm fired in US: Report
393.article_body: US-based Accenture recently told some of its employees that their work for Facebook "was soon being taken away", Insider has reported. The contractors, who were employed by Meta, were reportedly informed about their termination during a video call with nameless Accenture representatives. As many as 60 contractors were told they had been chosen for layoff "at random" via an algorithm.

394.title: Had LG not changed excise policy, Delhi would make ₹10,000 cr per yr: Dy CM
394.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Saturday said that had Delhi Lieutenant Governor (LG) not changed the decision on the excise policy, the Delhi government would have been getting at least ₹10,000 crore every year. "Excise policy due to which whole controversy is created is the country's best policy," he added. CBI on Friday raided Sisodia's residence.

395.title: Kejriwal on the rise, so time for BJP to destabilise: Kapil Sibal
395.article_body: Rajya Sabha MP Kapil Sibal took a swipe at CBI, ED and BJP-led government over raids at Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia's residence. "Sisodia raided by CBI. CBI, ED - the long arms of government. Now that [CM Arvind] Kejriwal is on the rise. Time for BJP to destabilise. So target [AAP leader] Satyendar Jain. Now Sisodia," tweeted Sibal.

396.title: CBI raid not over corruption, but to stop Arvind Kejriwal: Sisodia
396.article_body: After CBI raided his residence over an alleged liquor policy scam, Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said that the raid wasn't over corruption but to "stop the rise" of the national capital's CM Arvind Kejriwal. "I haven't done any corruption. I'm just...Kejriwal's Education Minister," he added. "Their target is Arvind Kejriwal because he works for development," he further said.

397.title: Video shows railway bridge collapsing amid flash flood in Himachal Pradesh
397.article_body: A railway bridge built on Chakki river in Kangra district of Himachal Pradesh collapsed amid flash flood and heavy rainfall. A video of the incident has also surfaced online. Mandi district also saw flash flooding on Saturday, with water entering houses and shops, trapping residents and damaging vehicles parked on the road, officials said.

398.title: Mexico arrests former Attorney General in 2014 missing students' case
398.article_body: Mexico's former Attorney General has been arrested in connection with the disappearance of 43 students in September 2014. Jesus Karam, who led an inquiry into the disappearance, has been charged with forced disappearance, torture and obstruction of justice. The students reportedly went missing while travelling by bus through the city of Iguala on their way to a protest.

399.title: Xiaomi's Q2 revenue falls 20% to $10.31 bn, net income drops 67%
399.article_body: China's Xiaomi posted a revenue of 70.17 billion yuan ($10.31 billion) in the second quarter of this year, recording a year-on-year drop of 20%. The consumer electronics maker's adjusted net income also dropped 67% year-on-year in Q2. Xiaomi President Wang Xiang said the resurgence of the COVID-19 pandemic in the country resulted in "difficult and weak" demand.

400.title: Teacher threatens student with physical abuse over BTS remark, later apologises
400.article_body: A teacher has apologised after a video of him mocking and threatening to beat up a female student went viral. The student had allegedly spammed the comments section of the online class with South Korean boy band-related messages. Mocking her for liking BTS, Misra had said, "If you weren't a girl, I would have grabbed your collar and slapped you."

401.title: Maybe within 3-4 days, CBI-ED will arrest me: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia
401.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Saturday said that CBI-ED might arrest him within the next three-four days. "We won't be scared, you won't be able to break us...the elections of 2024 will be AAP vs BJP," he added. CBI has named 15 accused, including Sisodia, in its FIR over the Centre's allegations of corruption in the liquor policy.
